    　　完肌散　治金疮。
    　　陈石灰二两　黄丹半两　龙骨　密陀僧　桑白皮各四两　麝香一钱，另研　　右为细末，干掺患处。

    　　生肌膏　治金疮及一切打损疮。
    　　胡粉　白芍药　熏陆香　干姜炮，各一两　油四两　黄蜡二两　　右为细末，以油蜡相和煎如膏，用贴疮上，日二换之。[119p]

    In the military, a pinch of gold powder:
    Two taels of young mulberry leaves and tender ramie leaves, one tael of mulberry leaves.
    Mash and apply. If you wish to achieve distant healing, dry them in the shade and make into powder, bind with cloth, and it will stop bleeding and close the wound, known as the Scorpion Grass Classic advance prescription, best gathered on May 5th or at the end of the day.

    Dragon Bone Powder: Treats injuries from sharp weapons, promotes flesh growth, stops pain and bleeding, and helps sores to heal.
    Equal parts of dragon bone, talc, burnt alum, cold water stone, frankincense, myrrh, and yellow lead, plus a little light powder. Grind into fine powder, to be used dry as an application, or as a plaster.

    Gold Injury Powder: Treats wounds from knives and axes, dispels wind, promotes flesh growth, and alleviates pain.
    Two taels of white acceptance, yellow lead, weathered lime, and mulberry white skin; one tael each of dragon bone, southern star, and white attached seed. Grind into fine powder for dry application.

    Flesh Restoration Powder: Treats gold wounds.
    Two taels of weathered lime, half tael of yellow lead, four taels each of dragon bone, myrtle, and mulberry white skin, plus one penny of musk, ground separately. Grind into fine powder and apply dry to the affected area.

    Flesh Growth Ointment: Treats gold wounds and all kinds of impact injuries.
    One tael each of hu powder, white peony root, incense, and dried ginger, four taels of oil, and two taels of yellow wax. Grind into fine powder, mix with oil and wax, and boil until it forms an ointment, apply to the wound, changing twice daily.[119p]

    　　定血散　治刀斧伤，止血定痛生肌。　　密陀僧半斤　鰞鲗鱼骨　龙骨　枯矾各二两　桑白皮一斤　黄丹一两　　右为细末，每用干掺患处，定血如神。
    　　王不留行散 【仲景】 　治金疮。　　王不留行八月八日采　蒴藋细叶七月七日采　东行桑根白皮三月三日采　甘草各十分　黄芩　干姜　芍药　厚朴各二分　川椒三分，去目及闭口者出汗　　右九味，桑根皮以上三味烧灰存性，勿令过，各别研，杵筛合治为散，服方寸匕。小疮即粉之，大疮但服之，产后亦可服。
    　　定痛乳香散　治金伤折骨，并打扑伤损。　　乳香　没药各二钱　败龟板一两　当归须　骨碎补　虎骨酥炙，各半两　紫金皮二两　半两钱五个，如无以自然铜火煅酢淬代之　穿山甲火炮，少许　　右为细末，每服一钱，如病沉，服二钱，以好酒调服。损上者食后服，损下者食前服。[120p]

    Ding Xue San: For treating wounds from axes and knives, it stops bleeding, alleviates pain, and promotes flesh growth. Ingredients include 250 grams of Mitong Seng, 100 grams of fish bones, 100 grams of dragon bones, and 100 grams of burnt alum; with 500 grams of mulberry bark and 3 grams of yellow lead. Grind everything into a fine powder and apply it dry to the affected area, and it will stop the bleeding effectively.

    Wang Bu Liu Xing San (by Zhon Jing): For treating metal wounds. Collect 8 pieces of Wang Bu Liu Xing on the 8th day of the 8th month; 7 pieces of Xu Neng fine leaves on the 7th day of the 7th month; 300 grams of white mulberry root bark harvested on the 3rd day of the 3rd month; 100 grams of licorice; and 2 grams each of Huang Qin, dry ginger, peony, and thick licorice; and 3 grams of Sichuan pepper. Remove the eyes and any closed-mouth pieces to induce sweating. These nine ingredients should be roasted until ash retains its properties. Each should be ground separately, then combined to make a powder. Take a thumb-sized dose. For small wounds, apply the powder; for large wounds, swallow it. It can also be taken post-partum.

    Ding Tong Ru Xiang San: For treating metal injuries and broken bones, as well as bruises from strikes. Ingredients include 6 grams each of frankincense and myrrh; 50 grams of turtle shell; half a handful of Angelica tendrils; half a handful of bone fragments; and half a handful of prepared tiger bone; along with 100 grams of purple gold skin and 3 grams of natural copper fired and dissolved as a substitute. A small amount of pangolin fire powder. Grind everything into a fine powder, and take a 3-gram dose. If the condition is severe, take 6 grams mixed with good wine. For upper injuries, take it after meals; for lower injuries, take it before meals.[120p]

    　　磁石散　治金疮肠出，宜用之。
    　　磁石煅研　滑石研　铁精各三两
    　　右为细末研匀，每服一钱匕，温酒调下，空心日午晚间各一服。仍以针砂涂肠上，其肠自收入。一方用白米饮调服。一方无铁精。
    　　当归散　一名内补散，一名苁蓉散。治金疮去血多，虚竭，此药内补。　　当归微炒　川芎　干姜炮　川椒去目闭口炒出汗　桂心　黄芩　桑白皮　吴茱萸汤浸焙干　白芍药　炙甘草各半两　肉苁蓉四两，酒浸一宿，去皮炒干　人参　黄芪　厚朴去粗皮姜汁炙令香熟，各一两　　右为细末，每服二钱，食前温酒讽下，日三四服。　一方有白芨，无黄芩、桑白皮
    　　内塞散　治金疮去血多，虚竭疼痛，羸弱内补。　　黄芪　当归　白芷　芎藭　干姜　黄芩　芍药　续断各二两　附子半两　细辛一两　鹿茸酥炙，三两　　右为细末，每服五分匕，食前酒调下，日三服，稍增至方寸匕。一方无芍药。[121p]

    Magnetic Stone Powder: For treating abdominal wounds with excessive bleeding, it is advisable to use this.

    Ingredients:

    • Magnetic stone, powdered and roasted: 3 liang
    • Talc, powdered: 3 liang
    • Iron essence: 3 liang

    Preparation: Mix these into a fine powder. Take one qian with a spoon, mixed with warm wine, and consume on an empty stomach at noon and in the evening. Additionally, apply needle sand on the abdomen to help it retract. One variation uses white rice drink for ingestion, while another omits iron essence.

    Angelica Decoction: Also known as Internal Supplement Decoction or Cistanche Decoction. Used for excessive bleeding from abdominal wounds and weakness; this medicine nourishes internally.

    Ingredients:

    • Slightly toasted Angelica: 0.5 liang
    • Chuan Xiong: 0.5 liang
    • Dry ginger, roasted: 0.5 liang
    • Sichuan Pepper (removed seeds and stalks, roasted to induce sweating): 0.5 liang
    • Cinnamon heart: 0.5 liang
    • Huang Qin: 0.5 liang
    • White mulberry root: 0.5 liang
    • Dried Wu Zhu Yu soaked in broth: 0.5 liang
    • Bai Shao (white peony): 0.5 liang
    • Honey-roasted licorice: 0.5 liang
    • Fresh Cistanche (4 liang, soaked in wine for one night, skinned and roasted)
    • Ginseng: 1 liang
    • Astragalus: 1 liang
    • Hou Po (with coarse skin removed and ginger juice roasted until fragrant): 1 liang

    Preparation: Grind these into a fine powder. Take two qian before meals with warm wine, three to four times a day. One variation includes Bai Ji but omits Huang Qin and Bai Bai Pi.

    Internal Blockage Powder: For treating abdominal wounds with excessive bleeding, weakness, pain, and fatigue; this helps nourish internally.

    Ingredients:

    • Astragalus: 2 liang
    • Angelica: 2 liang
    • White Peony: 2 liang
    • Chuan Xiong: 2 liang
    • Dry Ginger: 2 liang
    • Huang Qin: 2 liang
    • Bai Shao: 2 liang
    • Xu Duan: 2 liang
    • Fu Zi: 0.5 liang
    • Xi Xin: 1 liang
    • Deer Antler: 3 liang (roasted)

    Preparation: Grind these into a fine powder. Take half a qian with wine before meals, three times a day, gradually increasing to one qian. One variation omits Bai Shao.[121p]

    　　蒲黄散　治金疮血出，腹胀欲死。
    　　蒲黄　生地黄各一两半　黄芪　当归　芎藭　白芷　续断各一两　炙甘草三分　　右为细末，每服三钱匕，空心酒调下，日三四服，血化为水而下。若口噤，斡开口与之，仍加大黄一两半。
    　　神仙止血散
    　　龙骨五色紧者　诃子去核，各一两　白石脂　苎麻叶五月五日午时采阴干，各半两　　右为细末，每服一钱半，食远，水调服之。如修合时，忌妇人鸡犬见。
    　　败弩筋散　治金刃弓弩所中，筋急不得伸屈。　　败弩筋烧灰　秦艽　杜仲炙　熟地焙，各半两　附子炮去皮脐　当归切焙，各一两　大枣三枚，取肉焙　　右为细末，每服二钱匕，温酒调下，空心、日午、夜卧各一服。一方有续断，无大枣。[122p]

    Puhuang San

    Used for treating bleeding from golden wounds and abdominal swelling that may lead to death.
    Puhuang and Dihuang, each 1.5 liang; Huangqi, Danggui, Xiongshao, Baizhi, and Xuduan, each 1 liang; Zhigancao, 0.3 liang. Grind these into a fine powder. Take 3 qian with empty stomach, mixed with wine, three to four times a day, until the blood transforms into water and passes. If the mouth is locked, pry it open to administer, adding 1.5 liang of Dahuang.

    Shenxian Zhi Xue San

    Used for stopping bleeding.
    Longgu, 1 liang (dried under tight conditions); Hezi (with the pit removed), 1 liang; Baishizhi, 0.5 liang; and Mumuye (harvested at noon on May 5 and dried in the shade), 0.5 liang. Grind these into a fine powder. Take 1.5 qian when not near food, mixed with water. During periods of union, avoid women and the sight of chickens and dogs.

    Bainu Jin San

    Used for injuries caused by golden blades and crossbows where the tendons cannot stretch or bend.
    Burnt Bainu Jin, Qin Jiao, and Duzhong (roasted), each 0.5 liang; Fuzhi (processed, skin and navel removed), and Danggui (cut and roasted), each 1 liang; Dazao, 3 pieces, take the flesh and roast. Grind these into a fine powder. Take 2 qian with warm wine, three times: on an empty stomach, at noon, and before bed. In one formulation, Xuduan is included without the jujubes.[122p]

    　　虎骨散　治金疮中风发痉，肢节筋脉拘急。　　虎胫骨　败龟板各酥炙　当归　干蝎各微炒　桃仁去皮尖双仁麸炒　芎藭各一两　桂三分　黑豆五合　松脂二两　　右先将松脂并黑豆炒令熟，后和诸药捣为末，每服二钱，不拘时，温酒调下。[123p]

    Sheng Gan Di Huang San: Used to treat restlessness from gold sores. Contains Sheng Gan Di Huang, Chuan Gui (stir-fried), Tao Ren (peeled, double kernels), Bai Zhi, Xu Duan, Huang Qin, Chi Shao Yao, Ling Yang Jiao (horn shavings), and Zhi Gan Cao, each one liang; Xiong (Xiang) and Gui Xin each three fen. Grind finely and take two qian before meals with warm wine, three to four times a day.

    Bai Wei San: Treats restlessness and insomnia from gold sores, along with pain. Contains Bai Wei, Zhi Shi (stir-fried), Xin Yi Ren, (Cao She) Lou Gen, Chi Shao Yao, Zhi Gan Cao, each one liang; Suan Zao Ren two liang, lightly stir-fried. Grind finely and take two qian before meals with warm wine, three to four times a day.

    Hu Gu San: Treats gold sores with wind stroke causing spasms, stiffness in limbs and joints. Contains Hu Jing Gu, Bai Gui Ban (both roasted), Dang Gui, Gan Xie (lightly stir-fried), Tao Ren (peeled, double kernels, stir-fried), and Xiong each one liang; Gui three fen; Hei Dou five he; Song Zhi two liang. First roast the pine resin and black beans until cooked, then mix all ingredients and grind into a powder. Take two qian as needed with warm wine.[123p]

    　　踊铁膏 【《宝鉴》】 　取一切针刺入肉，箭头入肉。　　鼷鼠头一个，或用入油汁内熬　蝼蛄四十九枚　土消虫十个　芫青　巴豆　马肉蛆焙干　酱蛆焙干　信　夏枯草　硇砂　磁石　黄丹　地骨皮　苏木　蜣螂各一两　石脑油三两　蒿柴灰汁三升　　右将石脑油、蒿柴灰汁，文武火熬成膏，次下地骨皮等末令匀，磁器内收，临时用，量疮势大小点药，良久箭头自踊出。
    　　雄黄散　治药毒箭头在身未出。
    　　雄黄一分　粉霜半两，各细研　蜣螂四枚，研，生　巴豆三粒，去皮壳别研如泥，生　　右用研匀，以铜箸头取乳汁涂点疮上，频频用之，七日疮熟，箭头自出。

    Yong Tie Gao 【From "Bao Jian"】
    Take all types of needles and insert them into the flesh, like an arrowhead piercing the skin.
    One mouse head, or fry it in oil; forty-nine mole crickets; ten soil-dwelling insects; yanqing; ba dou; roasted horse meat maggots; roasted sauce maggots; letter; summer withering grass; naosha; magnet; yellow dan; earth bone peel; lignum vitae; and one tael of each type of dung beetle. Three taels of naphtha; three sheng of mugwort ash juice.
    First, combine the naphtha and mugwort ash juice and boil them down with even heat, then add the ground earth bone peel and other powders until mixed uniformly. Store in a ceramic container for temporary use. Apply medication according to the size of the wound, and after a while, the arrowhead will naturally push out.
    Xiong Huang San
    For treating drug poison that has entered the body from an arrowhead.
    One part realgar and half a tael of powdered frost, finely ground; four dung beetles ground into powder; three ba dou seeds with the skin removed, separately ground into paste.
    Combine these by grinding together, and using the tip of a copper chopstick, apply the milk to the wound. Use frequently, and after seven days, the wound will be matured, and the arrowhead will push out.
    Hong San Zi
    For application on gold wounds.
    Half a tael each of: caowu tip, qilinjie, eggplant flowers, and dehulled castor seeds, finely ground; half a tael of mandrake seeds.
    Mix these into a fine powder, and with good wine, adjust to a paste. Apply this mixture to the wound, and the arrowhead will come out naturally.[124p]

    Peony Powder
    For treating gold wounds with arrowheads lodged in the bone, not having expelled for many years:

    • Peony root, heart removed: 1 tael
    • White vine: 1 tael
    • White mulberry bark: 2 taels
    • Houxiang leaves: 1 fen
    • Clove: 1 fen
    • Musk, ground: 1 fen

    Mix into a fine powder. Take 2 qian with warm wine, three times a day. For shallow cases, ten days; for deep cases, twenty days, allowing the arrowhead to emerge on its own.

    Grub Pill
    For treating gold wounds with arrow points stuck in the bone for many years:

    • Five dried grubs
    • Three dried mole crickets
    • 1 fen of red beans
    • 1 tael of red carp vinegar
    • 1 qian of realgar
    • 3 qian of safflower powder

    Grind into a fine mixture, and make pills the size of mung beans. If there is an open wound, insert a pill into it. If there is no wound, pierce with a needle; take no more than 3 to 5 pills, and the arrowhead will come out easily with a slight shake.

    Arrowhead Removal Method

    • Ten dead scarab beetles
    • Three dogroots
    • A small amount of gray hair from a woman

    Remove the shells from the scarab beetles, take the white flesh and grind it with the two ingredients into a paste. Apply the paste directly to the arrow entry point like an ointment. After application, slight itching will occur; press with both hands, and the arrowhead will emerge on its own.

    Bone Releasing Pill
    For arrowheads that won’t come out:

    • Ground realgar
    • Ground scarab beetles
    • Ivory powder, all in equal parts

    Grind into a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of millet. Insert into the wound; later, finely chew sheep kidney fat and apply to the area until itching occurs, and the arrowhead will come out.[125p]

    Mouse Oil Ointment causes arrowheads to be expelled.
    Take one mouse and extract oil from it, use one penny each of dung beetle, soapwort ash, fine powder, dragon bone, and a small amount of frankincense ground separately. Mix the fine powder with the mouse oil to form an ointment, apply it to the wound, then cover it with magnetite powder, and the arrowhead will be expelled.

    Green Sulfate Powder treats bamboo grass thorn wounds that become swollen and painful, often without complete bleeding at the time of injury; affected by toxic qi, causing unrelenting pain and restless nights. Initially, when the wound breaks, it appears purplish, red, or black, with three to five layers of skin forming. Take half a tael of green sulfate, boil it in urine, add the sulfate, wait until cool, then take it out and dry. Add two and a half pennies of salvia, a word of musk, and one and a half pennies of Aristolochia root. Grind these into fine powder, wash the wound with a paste, and apply; immediate effectiveness follows.

    Another remedy treats thorns or needles from bamboo or wood that have pierced the flesh and remain lodged for many days, causing pain. Take a handful of black nightshade root and clean it. Measure one tael each of ginseng and lard from a pig in the twelfth lunar month, and a little vinegar. Grind the first two ingredients into powder, mix and knead until uniform, then apply a small amount to the wound; the thorn will be expelled.

    Ghost Substitute Powder is effective for reducing pain from strikes.
    Take nameless herb, myrrh, and frankincense, grind them; remove the soil from earthworms, and grind naturally aged copper with vinegar. Take the seeds of the water chestnut and remove the shell, mixing in equal parts. Grind everything into powder, then refine into honey pills the size of pellets. Take one with warm wine, and pain will cease.[126p]

    Spirit Ointment
    Treats sores from rods and golden sores, injuries from falls, skin tears, scalds, and long-standing ulcers.
    Ingredients:

    • 3 taels of Chuan yujin
    • 2 taels of Sheng dihuang
    • 1 jin of lard from old pig
    • 1 tael of pulverized grass

    Prepare by finely grinding the ingredients, simmering in the lard until darkened, filtering out the residue, and mixing in 4 taels of bright yellow wax until melted and evenly blended. Store in a ceramic container, soak in water for a long time, then remove the water to collect the ointment. When using, first wash the wound with cold water and dry it, apply the ointment to the wound, and cover it with white paper to stop bleeding and ease pain, without leaving scars. For scalds and burns, washing with water is unnecessary. Particularly effective for frostbite.

    Frankincense Ointment
    Highly effective for golden wounds and rod sores.
    Ingredients:

    • 7 qian each of frankincense, myrrh, Chuan qiong, and natural copper
    • 5 qian each of dang gui, qiang huo, du huo, Chuan niu xi, gypsum, liu ji nu, huang dan, black qian niu, huang bo pi, old paper, white jiao xiang, sheng dihuang, shu dihuang, chi shao, bai shao, zi jin pi, and bai zhi
    • 1 tael of yellow wax
    • 4 taels of clear oil

    Except for the jiao xiang, dan, and wax, grind the remaining herbs into fine powder and simmer in the oil, stirring continuously with a willow branch. Test for paste consistency, then add the three aforementioned ingredients, testing again until it forms a paste. Filter with fresh cloth, place in a container with water, and spread with a comb over wound openings. For deeper wounds, twist into paste strips and insert into the openings. Regardless of depth, place on the wound. If treating heat-related sores, add light powder, fragment of brain, and (shí bǔ) salt into the paste before applying.[129p]

    To prepare this medicine, take the following ingredients: one qian each of calcined water from Gan Stone, calcined white wax, dragon bone, frankincense, myrrh, balsam, camphor, and mercury; two liang of powdered light; one fen each of musk and powdered brain; half a liang of yellow wax; one liang of cypress wax; and one and a half liang of lard.

    The black plaster is effective for treating sores from injuries and various other wounds.

    Gather two liang each of coriander, yellow flower garden, cypress leaves, mint, and pig's eye; five qian each of wood frog, white atractylodes, apricot kernel, peach kernel, and fresh rehmannia; one liang each of protective wind, schizonepeta, forsythia, rhubarb, coptis, scutellaria, and phellodendron; one liang each of angelica, red peony, root of bellflower, frankincense, myrrh, catechu, rhubarb, and angelica; five qian each of cedar charcoal skin, balsam, calcined dragon bone, calcined stone wax, blood-resin, and camphor; two and a half qian each of calcined child's bone, mercuric sulfide; and five fen of musk.

    Prepare the last fifteen ingredients first, chop the first twenty-one into pieces, and simmer with water to reduce into a thick syrup. Filter out the residue and simmer again until the syrup has the consistency of syrup; then add two jin of lard and slowly cook until it dries. Next, mix in one jin of powdered light, stirring until black and forming a paste that can be rolled into beads when dropped into water, without sticking to hands. Finally, add two liang of yellow wax, melt it, and let it expel the toxicity over a few days. Briefly roast, then mix in the powdered frankincense and the last fifteen ingredients, stirring evenly, and spread on oil paper for application.[131p]

    　　秘傅膏药　专治打伤，又治金疮，及无名肿毒，臁疮。若跌伤及别样疮忌贴。　　真香油四两，将穿山甲、柏枝先入油中煎数沸，去二件渣，乘热将薄绵滤净油，复入锅中煎沸，以次下药。冬月用油五两　穿山甲一片　柏枝一根，以上二件，止取油煎汁，不用渣，取法见前　槐枝一茎，须另发开小条，不用大树上者，入药油，用此频搅　飞丹净水飞去标脚，取细末一两，作二次入油水花朱净水飞去标脚，晒干，取细末二钱　血竭　没药　乳香　孩儿茶以上四件，各三钱捶碎和匀，共入铜锅炭火上炒沸过为细末　新珍珠　新红象牙各面包烧存性，取细末，旧者不用　面粉炭火上烧黄色，各一钱　人指甲炒黄　三七晒干取细末　石乳铜锅内炒过取细末　黄连细末黄芩细末，各三分　海螵蛸五分　半夏大者十枚，为细末。[132p]

    Secret Salve: Specially cures injuries, treats deep wounds and unnamed swellings, as well as ulcers. It is not suitable for bruises and other types of sores.

    Use four ounces of true fragrant oil. First, simmer a piece of pangolin and a sprig of cypress in the oil until boiling several times. Remove the residue and, while hot, filter the oil through thin cotton. Return it to the pot and bring it to a boil, then add the following ingredients sequentially.

    In winter, use five ounces of oil, one piece of pangolin, and one sprig of cypress. For these two ingredients, only the oil infusion is needed, without the residue. Prepare a branch of locust, cut into small strips, not from a large tree. Add to the medicated oil and stir frequently.

    Using pure water, take one ounce of fine powder from “Fei Dan” (a medicinal product). Prepare this in two batches with fine powder that has been dried and sifted.

    For the preparation:

    • Three coins each of blood resin, myrrh, frankincense, and child tea, crushed and mixed together, roasted until fine in a copper pot over charcoal fire.

    New pearls and new red ivory should be baked until stable, then ground into fine powder; old ones are not used.

    One coin each of flour (burnt to yellow) and finger nails (frying them until brown), ground into fine powder.

    For “Shi Ru” (a type of medicinal stone), roast in a copper pot and grind into fine powder.

    Three coins of fine powder each of Coptis and Scutellaria, and five coins of sea cucumber, as well as ten larger pieces of Pinellia, ground into fine powder.[132p]

    以上十六件，俱用极细筛，筛过和匀，分作五分，留起一分。看膏药老嫩加减。止用四分，作四次下，下法如左　樟木细末，四钱　黄蜡二钱　冰片一分　麝香三分　阿魏成块者五分。以上四件，待诸药俱下尽，临起锅时方下，搅极匀，取出阿魏渣　　右药先将细末药分五分，其四分以次下锅如左。其一分留看药厚薄以为增减。如四分以下尽，药尚薄，亦将此分渐下。如正好，留此一分，待贴膏药时，掺在患处尤妙。煎法：用上好香油四两，入铜锅内炭火煎沸，沸时入柏枝一茎、穿山甲一片在内，煎数沸，去二药渣。[133p]

    The above sixteen items should be thoroughly sifted, blended evenly, and divided into five portions, keeping one portion aside. Observe the quality of the medicinal plaster and adjust the amounts. Use only four portions for the preparation, following the steps below:

    For the ingredients:

    • Camphor powder: 4 qians
    • Yellow wax: 2 qians
    • Borneol: 1 fen
    • Musk: 3 fens
    • Asafoetida chunks: 5 fens

    After combining the four ingredients, add them to the pot just before removing it from the heat. Stir thoroughly, and then remove the asafoetida residue.

    Now, take the fine powder and divide it into five portions. Gradually add four portions to the pot as described. Keep one portion to adjust the thickness of the medicine as needed. If the four portions have been added and the mixture is still thin, gradually add this remaining portion. If the consistency is just right, set this one portion aside to mix into the plaster when applying it to the affected area, which is particularly effective.

    For cooking: Use 4 liang of high-quality fragrant oil, place it in a copper pot, and heat over charcoal until boiling. When boiling, add a twig of cypress and a piece of pangolin shell, and boil several times before removing the two residues.[133p]

    将薄绵纸乘热滤净油，揩净锅，复入油于锅中煎沸，下飞丹五钱，用槐条急搅不住手，至成膏方止。候六七沸后，用清水漱净口，喷清水少许于锅中，即取起锅。一起锅时，于前四分中细末药，将一分渐渐逐一挑下，急搅如前。此分药尽，约均和了，将槐条蘸药滴水，且未要成珠，复置锅火上急搅，候沸起锅。二起锅，复将末药一分，渐入锅中，急搅如前，约均和滴水要成珠，复置锅炭火上急搅，候沸起锅。三起锅，渐下药，搅如前，约均和，将药滴水，虽成珠，尚要粘手，复置锅火上如前。四起锅，渐下药如前急搅，约均和，将药滴水成珠，珠要将至不粘手了，复置锅炭火上，候沸起锅。五起锅，即下黄蜡二钱、飞丹五钱，急搅如前，将药滴水成珠，要须不粘手，又不可太老了。[134p]

    Take a piece of thin rice paper, heat it to filter the oil, and clean the pot. Reintroduce the oil into the pot and bring it to a boil. Add five qian of red powder, and stir rapidly with a locust branch, continuing until it forms a paste. After six or seven boils, rinse your mouth with clear water and spray a little water into the pot, then take the pot off the heat. When lifting the pot, take one part of finely powdered medicine from the front four parts and gradually add it while stirring vigorously as before. When this portion is finished, achieve an even mixture. Dip the locust branch in the medicine and let drops form, but not yet as beads; return it to the heat and stir vigorously until it boils again.

    For the second addition, gradually add one portion of the powdered medicine to the pot and stir as before. When it reaches an even mixture, let drops form into beads and return it to the charcoal heat, stirring until it boils.

    For the third addition, gradually add the medicine and stir as before until evenly mixed. When the drops form beads, they should still be sticky; return to the fire as before.

    For the fourth addition, gradually add the medicine while stirring urgently until well mixed. When drops form beads, they should almost be non-sticky; return the pot to the charcoal fire and wait for it to boil again.

    For the fifth addition, add two qian of yellow wax and five qian of red powder, stirring urgently as before until the drops form beads that do not stick to your hands but are not too old.[134p]

    如尚粘手，将前留下一分末药渐下，以不粘手为度。如不粘手了，即下水花朱二钱，次下樟冰末四钱，急搅，方下麝三分、阿魏五分、冰片一分，急搅不住手，量药已均和了，捞阿魏渣去之，以药入磁器内，浸冷水中片时，候凝，将药寻露天天阳净地掘坎，将磁器倒覆于坎中，仍以土覆好，候七日后方起。一、藏法，用油纸及箬包好瓶口，以防泄气。一、摊膏药时，用汤中煎过，净油单纸摊上，药不用火烘，止用热汤入器中，将油纸放器上，以药放上摊开，又不用太厚，须于纸上照得见为妙。如以绢摊，用汤顿烊药摊上。一、贴时，先将莱菔汁桑叶煎汤，露中露过一宿，用以洗患处，方用贴之。一、既贴后，每日洗一遍，不要换膏药，至二三日后，血散风去，方换收口黑膏药，即万应膏也。[135p]

    If it still sticks to the hand, leave a bit of the powder to gradually fall, adjusting until it no longer sticks. When it is no longer sticky, add two qian of water, then four qian of camphor powder, stirring quickly. Then add three fen of musk, five fen of asafœtida, and one fen of borneol, stirring quickly until it’s well mixed. Remove the asafœtida residue, place the medicine in a ceramic vessel, and immerse it in cold water for a while to wait for it to solidify. Once it solidifies, expose the medicine to the sun in a clean place, dig a pit, invert the ceramic vessel into the pit, cover it with soil, and wait seven days before removing it.

    For preservation, use oil paper and bamboo leaves to tightly seal the bottle opening to prevent gas leakage. When applying the plaster, use hot soup to cook it, place clean oil paper on it, and do not heat the medicine directly; just place it in a warm container. Lay the oil paper on the container, spread the medicine on top, ensuring it is not too thick; it should be thin enough to see the paper underneath.

    If using silk for application, dissolve the medicine in hot soup and apply it on top. When applying, first simmer radish juice and mulberry leaves to prepare a wash, and let it steep overnight. Use this to wash the affected area before applying the plaster.

    After application, wash the area every day without changing the plaster. After two to three days, when blood disperses and wind is eliminated, replace it with the black plaster for wound closure, which is the ultimate remedy.[135p]

    　　万应膏　专主杖疮收口神效。

    Wan Ying Oil is specifically effective for healing ulcers with remarkable results.

    Prepare 2 pounds of true fragrant oil, filter it clean. Take 5 taels each of Huanglian, Huangbo, and Huangqin, and a bundle each of cypress and locust branches. Grind these thoroughly. Use 1 pound of red reshin, reduce it with water, dry it in the sun. For the gum resin, myrrh, dragon’s blood, and child tea, take 3 qian each. The four items mentioned should be pounded into powder and mixed, then add to a pot and fry over charcoal until boiling. Use elephant hide ash, fried with sand to remove impurities.

    Take 5 fen each of hai piao xiao and 1 qian of ban xia, and 5 fen of long gu. Grind these eight ingredients into a very fine powder, sieve through a fine mesh until well blended. Gradually add the following ingredients: 5 fen of asafetida.

    Next, take 2 pounds of true fragrant oil, filter it clean again, and put it in a copper pot to boil. Add Huanglian, Huangbo, Huangqin, and locust branches, boil for three to four times, then use fine summer cloth and thin silk paper to filter out the dregs; clean the copper pot, put the oil back in to boil, then add the previously prepared red reshin. Stir rapidly with locust branches until it drips into beads. While hot, transfer to a ceramic container, then gradually add the eight finely powdered herbs and asafetida, stirring vigorously until evenly mixed; remove the asafetida dregs. Allow to cool and after seven days, it can be used. Store and spread as described above.[136p]

    Iron Cloth Shirt Pill [from "Authentic Recipe"]

    This medicine, when taken in advance, allows one to endure torture without pain and also protects life.

    Natural copper is calcined and soaked in red vinegar seven times. Angelica is washed with wine and ground into a paste. Frankincense, nameless herb (cleaned of impurities), and the essence of Momordica oil are prepared using charcoal from meat. Myrrh and earthworm (cleaned and dried) are included, as well as sismiwood.

    Po Xue San: Treats injuries from falling off a horse, where bad blood in the spine flows under the ribs, causing unbearable pain that prevents turning. Ingredients: Qiang Huo, Fang Feng, and Rou Gui each 1 qian; stir-fried water leech ground to a fine powder 0.5 qian; Gui Shao, Chai Hu, and Lian Qiao each 2 qian; musk ground separately, a little.     Ding Tong Ru Xiang Shen Ying San (Dong Yuan): Treats unbearable pain after a fall, with abdominal pain.     Ying Tong Pill: Treats pain in the hands and feet after fractures and injuries due to the invasion of the four qi.     Ru Xiang San: Treats injuries causing unbearable pain in the hands and feet.     　　大芎黄汤　治风在里，宜疏导，急服此汤　　川芎　羌活　黄芩　大黄各一两
    　　右，五七钱，水煎温服，脏腑通和为度。
    　　白朮防风汤　治服表药过多，自汗者。　　白朮　黄芪各一两　防风二两
    　　右，每服五七钱，水煎服。脏腑和而自汗者可服。若脏腑秘，小便赤者，宜用大芎黄汤下之。
    　　白朮汤　治破伤风，汗不止，筋挛搐搦。　　白朮　葛根　升麻　黄芩　芍药各二两　甘草二钱五分　　右每服五钱，水煎，无时服。[141p]

    The right is a fine powder, taken with Fangfeng decoction.

    Qianghuo Decoction treats tetanus, used when the condition is half exterior and half interior; urgently take this decoction to slightly alleviate the evil entering within, but it should not be used if not suitable. Ingredients include Qianghuo, Chrysanthemum, Ephedra, Chuanxiong, Gypsum, Fangfeng, Fritillaria, Huangqin, Xixin, Licorice, Zhiqiao, Bai fuling, and Mianjingzi, each one liang; also, Mint and Bai zhi, each five qian. Take five qian each time, decocted with water.

    Diyu Fangfeng Powder treats wind in both the exterior and interior, with slight sweating of the head but none on the body; do not induce sweating, additionally treating both exterior and interior. Ingredients include Diyu, Fangfeng, Didingcao, and Maçi xian, each in equal parts. The right is a fine powder, take three qian each time, mixed with rice soup.

    Daqianghuang Decoction treats wind in the interior and is appropriate for dispersing it; urgently take this decoction. Ingredients include Chuanxiong, Qianghuo, Huangqin, and Dahuang, each one liang. The right is fifty to seventy qian, decocted with warm water for consumption, to harmonize the organs.

    Baizhu Fangfeng Decoction treats excessive use of exterior medicinals leading to spontaneous sweating. Ingredients include Baizhu and Huangqi, each one liang, and Fangfeng two liang. The right is taken five to seven qian each time, decocted with water. It can be taken if the organs are harmonious and there is spontaneous sweating. If the organs are blocked and urination is red, it is advisable to use Daqianghuang Decoction for treatment.

    Baizhu Decoction treats tetanus with persistent sweating, muscle spasms, and cramping. Ingredients include Baizhu, Gegen, Shengma, Huangqin, and Shaoyao, each two liang, and Licorice two qian and five fen. The right is taken five qian each time, decocted with water, without a specific time for consumption.[141p]

    　　谦甫朱砂丸　治破伤风，目瞪，口噤不语，手足搐搦，项筋强直，不能转侧，目不识人。　　朱砂研　半夏洗　川乌各一两　雄黄五钱　凤凰台三钱　麝香一字　　右为末，枣肉丸桐子大，每服一丸或二丸，冷水下，以吐为度。如不吐，加一丸。或吐不住，煎葱白汤止之，汗出为效。
    　　左龙丸　治直视，在里者。
    　　左盘龙即野鸽粪也　白僵蚕　鱼鳔炒，各五钱　雄黄一钱　　右为末，烧饭丸桐子大，每服十五丸，温酒下。如里证不已，当用前药末一半，加巴豆霜半钱，烧饭丸梧子大，每服加入一丸。如此渐加，以利为度。利后，服和解药。
    　　江鳔丸　治破伤风，传入里证，惊而发搐，脏腑秘濇。　　江鳔銼碎炒　野鸽粪炒　白僵蚕各半两　雄黄一钱　蜈蚣一对　天麻一两　　右为末，作三分，二分烧饭丸桐子大，朱砂为衣；一分入巴豆霜一钱，亦用烧饭丸。每服朱砂者二十丸，入巴豆者一丸，渐加至利为度，后止服前丸。[142p]

    Qianfu Zhu Sha Wan treats tetanus, with symptoms including wide-eyed gaze, inability to speak or move limbs, neck stiffness, and lack of recognition of people.

    Ingredients: Zhu Sha, Ban Xia (washed), Chuan Wu (each one tael), Xiong Huang (five qian), Feng Huang Tai (three qian), and a pinch of Musk. Grind the ingredients to a powder, shape into jujube-sized pills, and take one or two with cold water to induce vomiting as needed. If not vomited, add one more pill. If unable to stop vomiting, take scallion white soup to halt it; sweating indicates effectiveness.

    Zuo Long Wan treats direct gaze and internal issues.

    Zuo Pan Long, which is wild dove feces, combined with Bai Jiang Can (white silkworm) and fish bladder (each five qian), and one qian of Xiong Huang. Grind to a powder, make into rice pills the size of jujube, and take fifteen pills with warm wine. If internal symptoms persist, use half of the previously mentioned powder and add half a qian of Ba Dou Shuang. Make rice pills the size of Wutong (Chinese parasol tree) seeds, adding one pill each time. Gradually increase until favorable results are achieved. Afterwards, take harmonizing medicine.

    Jiang Piao Wan treats tetanus that enters the interior, marked by fright and spasms, with internal stagnation of the viscera.

    Ingredients include Jiang Piao (fish bladder, finely crushed and fried), wild dove feces (fried), Bai Jiang Can (white silkworm) (each half a tael), one qian of Xiong Huang, one pair of centipedes, and one tael of Tian Ma.

    Grind into a powder, divide into three parts: two parts into rice pills the size of jujube coated with Zhu Sha; one part into one qian of Ba Dou Shuang, also made into rice pills. For each dose, take twenty pills with Zhu Sha and one with Ba Dou, gradually increasing until favorable results are achieved, then stop taking the initial pills.[142p]

    外科跌打金刃竹木破伤门

    Nourishing Blood Danggui Dihuang Decoction
    Danggui, Dihuang, Shaoyao, Chuanxiong, Gaoben, Fangfeng, Baizhi, each 1 liang; Xixin 5 qian. Prepare as previously instructed.

    Guangli Formula for treating tetanus fever.
    (Wild) Luzi 9 qian, Huashi 3.5 qian, Nanshen, Chishaoyao, Cangzhu, Chenpi, Huangbo (stir-fried), Huanglian, Huangqin, Baizhi, Gancao, each 5 fen. Prepare with ginger water. Note: The two formulas above using bamboo juice and (wild) Luzi are for treating tetanus with hot phlegm and a strong pulse. The first formula with Nanshen, Banxia, Caowu, and Chuanwu is for treating tetanus with cold phlegm and a weak pulse.

    Baiwanzi for treating all types of wind phlegm blockage, persistent numbness of the hands and feet, or signs like clenched jaws, crooked mouth, and hemiplegia. Banxia 7 liang (raw), Nanshen 2 liang (raw), Chuanwu (peeled and raw) 5 qian. Grind into powder, mix with fresh ginger juice to form pills the size of a tung seed, take 10-20 pills with ginger soup.

    Surgery for falls and trauma with sharp instruments, bamboo, and wood injuries.

    Single prescription.[143p]

    　　跌扑金刃伤损：以香炉灰罨之，止血生肌。
    　　金疮血出不止：冷水浸之，即止。

    　　金疮困顿：用蚯蚓屎末水服方寸匕，日三服。 【《千金》，下同。】
    　　瘢痕凸起：用热瓦频熨之。

    　　金疮出血：不可以药早合，恐内溃伤肉，只以黄丹、滑石等分为末敷之。　　又方：云母粉敷之绝妙。 【《事林广记》】　　又方：白薇为末点之。 【子和】
    　　又方：用门臼尘，切蒜蘸擦。或不用蒜。　　又方：嫩紫苏桑叶同捣贴之。 【《永类方》】
    　　金疮内漏：雄黄半豆大纳之，仍以小便服五钱，血皆化为水。 【《肘后方》】　　又方：牡丹皮为末，水服，三指撮，立尿出血也。 【《千金》，下同。】　　又方：取疮中所出血，以水和服之。

    • For wounds from a fall on a sharp edge: cover with incense ash to stop the bleeding and promote healing of the flesh.

    • If the bleeding from a gold wound does not stop: soak in cold water, and it will cease.

    • If the gold wound is severe: take water mixed with earthworm feces the size of a thumb for three doses daily.

    • For raised scars: use a hot tile to frequently press the area.

    • For bleeding from a gold wound: do not apply medicine too early, as it may lead to internal rot of the flesh; simply use equal parts of yellow ochre and talc as a powder to apply. Another method: apply powdered mica, which works remarkably well. Another method: apply powdered white peony. Another method: use dust from a mortar mixed with garlic for rubbing; garlic may be omitted. Another method: crush fresh perilla leaves and mulberry leaves together to apply.

    • For internal bleeding from a gold wound: take half a bean-sized amount of realgar, and drink five qian of urine; all the blood will turn to water. Another method: take powdered peony root and drink it, with a pinch the size of three fingers; it will immediately stop the bleeding. Another method: take the blood that oozes from the wound, mix with water, and drink.

    • If bleeding from a gold wound persists: mix cold stone and pitch into a powder, and apply it dry, ensuring it does not come into contact with water. Another method: apply powdered galls. If the individual is breathless, take two qian of powdered galls mixed with a small amount of dragon bone powder, boil and drink; it will be effective immediately.[144p]

    　　金疮血出：取老杉树皮烧存性研敷之，或入鸡子清调敷，一二日愈。　　又方：刮白檀末敷之，且能止痛。

    　　金疮出血：沥青末少加生铜屑末，掺之立愈。 【《经验方》】
    　　金疮出血不止，闷绝：蒲黄半两，热酒灌下。 【《得效方》，下同】　　又方：血见愁草研烂涂之。

    　　金疮血出不止：生面干敷，五七日即愈。 【《经验方》】　　又方：韭汁和风化石灰，日干，每用为末敷之，效。 【《集简方》】　　又方：稗苗根捣敷，或研末掺之即止，甚验。　　又方：以葱炙熟挼汁涂之，即止。 【《梅师方》】　　又方：慈石末敷之，止痛断血。 【《千金》，下同。】　　又方：车前叶捣敷之。[145p]

    For bleeding from gold wounds: Take the bark of an old fir tree, burn it, grind it into a powder, and apply it. Alternatively, mix it with egg white and apply; it will heal in one or two days.

    Another method: Scrape white sandalwood powder and apply, which can also relieve pain.

    Another method: Mix equal parts of frankincense, gall, and copper flower into a powder for application. You may also scrape frankincense off a porcelain tile and grind it into powder.

    For bleeding from gold wounds: Use half a pound of pomegranate flowers and one liter of lime, crush and dry them in the shade; apply a small amount each time, and it will stop immediately.

    For bleeding from gold wounds: Mix a small amount of asphalt powder with fresh copper filings, and combining them will cause an instant cure.

    If bleeding does not stop and there is suffocation: Take half a tael of cattail pollen and drink it down with hot wine.

    Another method: Grind sorrow grass and apply it to the bleeding area.

    If bleeding from gold wounds does not stop: Apply raw flour; it will heal in five to seven days.

    Another method: Mix leek juice with slaked lime, dry it daily, and apply it as a powder; it is effective.

    Another method: Crush barnyard millet roots and apply them, or mix the powdered form to stop bleeding, and it is very effective.

    Another method: Soak green onions, roast them until soft, press out the juice, and apply it; it will stop immediately.

    Another method: Apply powdered liverwort to stop pain and bleeding.

    Another method: Crush plantain leaves and apply.[145p]

    　　又方：白芍药一两，熬黄为末，或酒或米饮服二钱，渐加之，仍以末敷之，良。 【《广利方》】　　又方：蛇含草捣敷之。 【《肘后方》】

    Another method: One tael of white peony root, roasted and ground into powder, mixed with either wine or rice drink, take two qian, gradually increase the dosage, and apply the powder externally; this is effective. 【"Guangli Fang"】

    Another method: Mash snake-sugar grass and apply it. 【"Zhouhou Fang"】

    　　金疮扑损：用青蒿捣封之，血止则愈。 【《肘后方》】　　又方：用青蒿麻叶石灰等分，五月五日捣和晒干，临时为末搽之。　　又方：夏枯草口嚼窨上，即愈。 【《易简方》】

    Wounds from gold and injuries: Use Qinghao to pound and apply; when the bleeding stops, it heals. Another recipe: Combine equal parts of Qinghao, sesame leaves, and lime, pound together, dry under the sun on the fifth day of the fifth month, and use as a powder for application. Another recipe: Chew summer withering grass and place it on the affected area for immediate healing.

    Poison arrows lodged in flesh: Boil fresh Rehmannia juice to form pills; take until the hundredth day for the arrow to come out.

    Bamboo or wood in flesh: Chew fresh Rehmannia and apply it.

    Pain from golden wounds: Pound fresh cow's knee and apply it; pain stops immediately. For cuts from knives or axes: Chew fresh ginger and apply without movement; flesh grows back by the next day, which is quite remarkable. For wounds from cutting tools: Grind single-shelled chestnuts and apply, or chewing and applying in haste is also acceptable.

    If arrows, knives, bamboo, or wood are embedded in the flesh or in hidden areas like the throat or chest and cannot come out: Mix chirita powder with wine to take twice daily. Another recipe: Take Wangbu Liu powder with warm water and take a spoonful, also applying the root externally to help with expulsion.[147p]

    　　卒被毒箭：麻仁数升，杵汁饮。 【《肘后方》，下同。】
    　　毒箭伤人：蓝青捣饮并敷之。如无蓝，以青布渍汁，效。
    　　金疮烦痛，大便不利：大黄、黄芩等分为末，蜜丸，先食水下十丸，日二服。
    　　箭头不出：万坚神应丹。端午前一日不语，寻见莨菪科根本枝叶花实，令好者，道云：先生你却在这里！道罢，用柴灰自东南起围了，以木子捭掘，取根下周回土；次日日未出时，依前不语，用镢头取出洗净，勿令鸡犬妇人见，于净室中，以石臼捣如泥，丸弹子大，黄丹为衣，以纸袋封悬高处，阴干。遇有箭头不出者，先以象牙末贴疮口，后用绯帛袋盛此药，放脐中，绵兜肚系，当便出也。
    　　金刀不出，入骨脉中者：半夏、白蔹等分为末，酒服方寸匕，日三服，至二十日自出。【《太白经》】
    　　被斫断筋：菖蒲根捣汁，沥疮中，仍以渣敷之，日三易，半月即断筋更续，此方有效。【《外台》】[148p]

    • For being struck by a poisoned arrow: grind several liters of hemp seeds, and make a drink from the juice.
    • If injured by a poisoned arrow: prepare a drink from crushed indigo; if indigo is unavailable, use blue cloth soaked in juice as a substitute.
    • For severe pain from a golden wound and difficulty with bowel movements: mix equal parts of rhubarb and skullcap into a powder, then make honey pills. Take ten pills with water before meals, twice daily.
    • If an arrowhead does not come out: use the "Invincible Divine Response Elixir." On the day before the Dragon Boat Festival, do not speak. Seek out the roots, stems, leaves, and flowers of the Nightshade family. When you find a good one, say: "Sir, you are right here!" After speaking, encircle it with wood ashes from the southeast. Dig around it with a hoe to extract the roots carefully; on the next day when the sun has not yet risen, continue to remain silent. Use the hoe to take it out, wash it clean, and ensure no chickens, dogs, or women see it. In a clean room, pound it in a stone mortar until it is like mud, make it into pills the size of small balls, coat them with yellow lead, seal in a paper bag, and hang them in a high place to dry in the shade. For those with arrowheads that do not come out, first apply ivory powder to the wound, then place this medicine in a scarlet silk bag and put it in the navel, tying a cotton cloth around the abdomen; it should come out immediately.
    • For a golden knife that has penetrated to the bones and veins: grind equal parts of pinellia and white vine into a powder, take the size of a thumb with wine, three times a day; it will expel itself within twenty days.
    • For severed tendons: crush the root of sweet flag to extract juice, drain it into the wound, and apply the dregs as a dressing, changing it three times a day; within half a month, the severed tendons will reconnect—this remedy is effective.[148p]

    　　金疮肿痛：蔷薇根烧灰，每白汤服方寸匕，一日三服。 【《抱朴子》】
    　　箭刺入肉，脓裹不出：以蔷薇根末掺之，服鼠璞十日，即穿皮出也。 【《外台》，下同。】　　又方：(艹舌)蒌根捣敷，三易自出，针刺入肉，同方。
    　　伤筋出血：葛根捣汁饮，干者煎服，仍熬屑敷之。
    　　金疮瘘孔：通草煮汁酿酒，日饮。鼠瘘不消方同。
    　　金疮伤损，生肌破血：用紫葛二两，顺流水三盏，煎一盏半，三服，酒煎亦妙。 【《经效方》】
    　　金疮肠出，用小麦五升，水九升，煮取四升，绵滤取汁，待极冷，令病人卧席上，含汁唾噀之，肠渐入，噀其背，并勿令病人知，及多见人旁人语，即肠不入也。乃抬席四角轻摇，使肠自入。十日中，但略食炙物，慎勿惊动，即杀人。　　又方：大麦粥汁洗肠推入，饮米糜百日乃可。 【《千金》，下同。】
    　　箭镝在咽，或刀刃在咽膈诸隐处：杵杏仁敷之。[149p]

    For gold wounds that are swollen and painful: Burn rose roots to ash and take a pinch with warm water, three times a day.

    For arrow wounds that have penetrated the flesh and are festering: Mix powdered rose roots and take mouse skin for ten days until it breaks through the skin. Additionally, for needles that have penetrated the flesh, use the same method with crushed (grass tongue) mulberry root applied externally, changing it three times.

    For muscle injury with bleeding: Drink juice from crushed kudzu root; for dried kudzu, boil it and apply the remnants externally.

    For gold wounds with abscesses: Boil the juice of common rush and brew it as wine for daily consumption. The same method applies to mouse fistulas that do not heal.

    For gold wounds causing tissue loss and bleeding: Use two taels of purple kudzu, three cups of running water, reduce to one and a half cups through boiling, take three doses; boiling with wine works well too.

    For gold wounds with intestinal protrusion: Use five sheng of wheat and nine sheng of water, boil down to four sheng, filter it through cotton when very cold, and have the patient lie on a mat and hold the juice in their mouth, spitting it out until the intestines gradually retract. Do not let the patient know or allow them to see people talking, otherwise the intestines will not retract. Gently lift and sway the four corners of the mat to help the intestines go back in. During the ten days, only eat slightly roasted foods and avoid any excitement to prevent fatal outcomes.

    Another method: Use barley porridge juice to wash and push the intestines back, drinking rice gruel for a hundred days should be sufficient.

    For arrows or blades stuck in hidden places such as the throat: Crush apricot kernels and apply them.[149p]

    　　金疮断筋：枫香末敷之。 【《得效方》】
    　　金刃斫伤未透膜者：乳香、没药各一钱，以童子小便半盏，酒半盏，温化服之，为末亦可。【《良方》】　　金疮出血：血竭末敷之，立止。 【《广利方》】　　又方：柳絮封之，即止。 【《外台》】
    　　金疮苦痛：杨木白皮熬燥碾末，水服方寸匕，仍敷之，日三次。 【《千金》】
    　　金疮接指：凡指断及刀斧伤，用真苏木末敷之，外以蚕茧包缚完固，数日如故。 【《摄生方》】
    　　箭镞入肉不可拔出者：用新巴豆仁略熬，与蜣螂同研涂之，斯须痛定，微痒忍之，待极痒不可忍，使撼拔动之取出，速以生肌膏敷之。
    　　金刃伤疮：新桑白皮烧灰和马粪涂疮上，数易之。亦可煮汁服之。
    　　刀疮伤湿，溃烂不生肌者：寒水石煅一两，黄丹二钱为末，洗敷；甚者加龙骨一钱，孩儿茶一钱。
    　　疮肿作痛：生椒末釜下土荞麦粉等分，研酢和敷之。 【《外台》】[150p]

    • For gunshot wounds that sever tendons: apply powdered fragrant maple.
    • For wounds from a sharp blade that have not penetrated the membrane: mix one tael of frankincense and myrrh each with half a cup of a boy's urine and half a cup of wine, warm and take it. It is also acceptable to make it into a powder.
    • For gunshot wounds with bleeding: apply powdered dragon's blood to stop it immediately.
    • Another method: seal with willow catkins to stop the bleeding.
    • For painful gunshot wounds: grind the dried white bark of the poplar, take a spoonful with water, and apply it three times a day.
    • For reattaching severed fingers: use genuine red sandalwood powder and wrap it firmly with silk cocoons, and it will heal in a few days as before.
    • If an arrowhead is embedded in flesh and cannot be pulled out: use fresh houpu seeds slightly cooked, ground with dung beetles, and apply it. The pain will settle quickly; endure mild itching, and when it becomes intolerable, gently pull it out. Quickly apply wound dressing.
    • For gun wounds: burn the fresh white bark of mulberry and mix the ash with horse dung to apply on the wound; change it multiple times. Alternatively, it can be taken as juice.
    • For knife wounds that are damp and not healing: calcine one tael of cold water stone, mix with two coins of yellow lead as powder, wash and apply; for severe cases, add one coin of dragon bone and one coin of children's tea.
    • For swollen and painful wounds: mix ground fresh pepper with equal parts of buckwheat flour and vinegar, then apply.[150p]

    　　破伤风水毒肿痛不可忍：麝香末一字，纳疮中，出尽脓水便效。 【《普济》】
    　　打伤颠扑及牛马触动，腹破血流，四肢摧折：以乌鸡一只，连毛杵一千二百下，苦酒三升和匀，以新布拓病处，将膏涂布上，觉寒振欲吐，徐徐取下；须臾再上一鸡，少顷再作，以愈为度。【《肘后》】
    　　破伤风：腊月收取狐目阴干，临时用二目一副，炭火微烧存性研末，无灰酒服方寸匕，神效无比。【《保寿堂方》】
    　　　高坠下，瘀血抢心，面青气短：取乌鸦右翅七枚，烧研酒服，当吐血便愈。 【《肘后方》】
    　　伤损接骨：鹰骨烧灰，每服二钱酒服，随病上下，食前食后。　　又方：雕骨烧灰，每服二钱酒下，在上食后，在下食前，骨即接如初。 【《接骨方》】　　又方：用下窟鸟，即鹗也，取骨烧存性，以古铜钱煅红，酢淬七次为末等分，酒服一钱，不可过多，病在下，空心；在上，食后服，极有效验。须先夹缚定，乃服此。[151p]

    When dealing with tetanus and severe swelling that is unbearable: Use powdered musk, insert it into the wound, and once the pus is expelled, it will take effect.

    For injuries from falls or impacts from cattle and horses, with abdominal bleeding and broken limbs: Take one black chicken, beat it 1,200 times with its feathers, mix it with three sheng of bitter wine, apply the mixture to the affected area with fresh cloth, and if a cold sensation and nausea are felt, gradually remove it. Repeat with another chicken shortly afterward.

    For tetanus: In the twelfth month, collect the eyes of a fox and dry them in the shade. Use two eyes in a pair, burn them slightly to retain their properties, grind into powder, and take with a small amount of undiluted liquor; it works remarkably well.

    In cases of high falls causing internal bleeding, resulting in a bluish face and shortness of breath: Take seven right wings of a crow, burn and grind them, then mix with wine to consume; the patient will recover when vomiting blood.

    For bone injuries: Burn eagle bones to ash, take two qian with wine before and after meals as needed. Another method: Burn hawk bones to ash, take two qian with wine before meals when the injury is below, and after meals when above; the bones will unite as before.

    Another method: Use the bone of the serpent eagle, burn it to retain its properties, and after heating ancient copper coins to red-hot, quench it seven times, then grind it into equal parts powder. Consume one qian with wine, not too much. If the injury is below, take on an empty stomach; if above, take after meals, and it will be very effective. Be sure to first bind the injury securely, and then take this remedy.[151p]

    　　打伤青肿：炙猪肉搨之。 【《千金》】
    　　杖疮血出：猪血一升，石灰七升，和剂烧灰，再以水和丸又烧，凡三次，为末敷之，效。【《外台》】

    　　折伤接骨：用土鳖焙存性为末，每服二三钱，接骨神效。或取生者擂汁，酒服。 【《摘要方》】　　又方：用蚵蚾即土鳖六钱，隔纸炒，锅内焙干，自然铜二两，用火煅酢淬七次为末，每服二钱，温酒调下。病在上食后，病在下食前，神效。【《袖珍方》】　　又方：用土鳖阴干一个，临时旋研，入乳香、没药、龙骨、自然铜火煅酢淬各等分，麝香少许为末，每服三分，入土鳖末，以酒调下。须先整定骨乃服药，否则接错也。此乃家传秘方。慎之！又可代杖。【《集验方》】[152p]

    To treat bruises: pound roasted pig meat on the affected area.

    For bleeding from wounds due to a blow: use one liter of pig's blood, seven liters of lime, mix and burn to ash, then further process with water and form into pills; apply the powder, effective.

    For injuries from falls causing blood stasis and bone pain: take deer antler powder with wine, about a thumb-length dosage, three times a day.

    If bamboo or wood is embedded in the flesh and doesn't come out: use burnt deer antler powder mixed with water to apply; it will come out quickly, usually within a night.

    For broken bones: use soil insects (tubifex) dried and ground into powder, take two to three qian per dose; it is highly effective for bone setting. Alternatively, take fresh ones and extract juice, mixed with wine.

    Another formula: take six qian of soil insects, fry between paper, and dry in a pan, along with two taels of natural copper, and calcine with vinegar seven times to make powder. Take two qian each time, mixed with warm wine. The effectiveness depends on the timing of ingestion relative to food.

Take three fen, mixed with soil insect powder and wine. Ensure the bones are properly aligned before taking the medicine, otherwise, it may result in misalignment. This is a family secret recipe; handle with care! It can also be used to replace a cane.[152p]

    For bruises and blood stasis: Twenty pieces of the bone-sucking insect (zhú), one tael of peony bark powdered. Take a thumb-sized amount with wine to transform blood into water. If there is longstanding blood in the joints, use equal parts of the two ingredients.

    　　损伤接骨：五灵脂一两，茴香一钱为末，先以乳香末于极痛处敷上，以小黄米粥涂之，乃掺二末于粥上，帛裹，木牌子夹定，三五日效。【子和】

    Healing Fractures: One liang of fragrant resin and one qian of fennel, ground into powder. First, apply powdered frankincense to the extremely painful area, then coat it with a porridge made of small yellow rice. Next, mix the two powders into the porridge, wrap it in cloth, and secure it with a wooden board. It will be effective in three to five days.

    For Abdominal Bruises: Burn white horse hoof until it is fully consumed, then grind it into powder. Take one thumb-sized amount with wine, three times a day, and once at night; this will transform the blood into water.

    For Internal Injuries from Falls and Blows: One liang each of water caltrop and musk, crushed and burned until fragrant, ground into powder.     　　一切金疮及刀斧伤：白僵蚕炒黄研末敷之，立愈。 【《斗门方》】

    • For all gold wounds and injuries from knives and axes: fry and grind white silkworms into a fine powder to apply; it will heal immediately.
    • For knife and axe wounds: on the Dragon Boat Festival at noon, take evening silkworm moths, lime, and reed flowers, grind them into a ball, cover with grass until heated, and store. Scrape off some powder each time for use.
    • For arrows lodged in flesh: use the juice of a mole cricket, dripping it three to five times until it comes out.
    • For all sores caused by wind: take one liter of fresh Sichuan pepper and mix it with a little flour to wrap and seal the pepper, ensuring it does not allow air to escape. Divide into two wraps, burn them under hot ash until cooked, poke a hole at the tip, and apply it to the sore, allowing the pepper’s scent to penetrate; replace it once it cools. Shortly after, the sore will exude fluid, and the body will break out in cold sweat, indicating healing.
    • If a bone is lodged in flesh and cannot be removed: chew on evodia and seal it; the bone will eventually rot and come out.
    • For severe traumatic injuries with wind leading to near death: grind centipedes into a powder, rub it on the teeth, and the saliva will immediately cease. Another method: use two qian of toad venom, mix it with water to form a paste, fry dry scorpions in wine, and take half a liang of gastrodia; combine and form into pills the size of mung beans, taking one to two pills with wine. Another recipe includes grinding centipede heads, aconite roots, and scorpion tails into a powder, taking one or half of a character’s worth, and washing it down with hot wine while applying heat to the sore to promote sweating and healing.[155p]

    　　金疮胁破肠出：以干人屎末，抹入桑皮线缝合，热鸡血涂之。 【《生生编》】　　又方：以香油摸手送入，煎人参、枸杞子汁温淋之，吃羊肾粥十日即愈。 【《得效方》】　　又方：将肠纳入，以慈石、滑石各三两为末，米饮，服方寸匕，日再服。
    　　刺在肉中：嚼豉涂之。

    For injuries: Take one otter, dismember it and place it in a jar. Prepare it until dry, calcine it to create a powder. Cook millet porridge and apply it to the affected area, mixing the otter powder on top, then wrap it with cloth. It will immediately stop the pain.

    For deep wounds causing intestines to protrude: Use dried human feces powder to apply to the sutured area with mulberry bark thread, and cover it with hot chicken blood.     For injuries under the skin: Chew soybeans and apply them.

    　　箭镞入内不可拔者：用螳螂一个，巴豆半个，同研敷伤处，微痒且忍，极痒乃撼拔之，以黄连、贯众汤洗拭，石灰敷之。　　又方：用天水牛取一角者小瓶盛之，入硇砂一钱，同水数滴在内，待自然化水，取滴伤处，即出也。
    　　抓疮伤水，肿痛难忍：耳垢敷之，　一夕水尽出而愈。
    　　破伤风，手足颤掉，搐搦不已：用人手足指甲烧存性六钱，姜制南星、独活、丹砂各二钱为末，分作二服，酒下立效。【《普济方》】
    　　破伤风，作白痂无血者，杀人最急：以黄雀屎直者研末，热酒服半钱。
    　　破伤风搐口噤强直者：香胶散。用香胶烧存性一两，麝香少许为末，每服二钱，苏木煎酒调下；仍煮一钱，封疮口。【《得效方》】
    　　破伤风，有表证未解者：用江鳔半两，炒焦娱蚣一对炙研为末，以防风、羌活、独活、川芎等分煎汤，调服一钱。【河间】[157p]

    If an arrowhead cannot be removed after penetrating, use one mantis and half a nut, grind together and apply to the wound. If it feels slightly itchy, endure it; if it becomes extremely itchy, then it can be shaken out. Wash with a decoction of coptis and guan zhong, and apply lime.

    Another formula: Take a small bottle of water from a celestial cow’s horn, add one qian of powdered cadmium, and a few drops of water to dissolve it. Apply the drops to the wound, and it will be expelled.

    For swollen and painful wounds: Apply earwax, and the water will diminish overnight, leading to healing.

    For tetanus with symptoms such as trembling hands and feet: Use six qian of burnt fingernails, and two qian each of ginger-prepared southern star, angelica pubescens, and cinnabar, finely ground into powder. Divide into two doses and take with wine for immediate effect.

    For tetanus producing white scabs without blood, which is particularly dangerous: Grind up the excrement of a yellow bird and take half a qian with hot wine.

    For severe tetanus with strong mouth clenching and stiffness: Use fragrant gum powder. Take one liang of fragrant gum burned to bonfire ashes, a little musk finely ground, each dose two qian, take with wine and simmered logwood; also boil one qian to seal the wound.

    For tetanus with unresolved surface symptoms: Use half a liang of river eel, fry it until burnt, grind it with one pair of roasted centipedes into powder, and boil it with equal parts of fangfeng, qinghao, angelica pubescens, and chuanxiong, taking one qian of the decoction.[157p]

    　　疮伤风水痛剧欲死者：牛屎烧烟，熏令汗出，即愈。 【《外台》】
    　　狐尿刺疮痛甚者：热白马尿渍之。 【《千金》】　　又方：干蝎、麝香各一分为末，敷患处，风去速愈。 【《普济方》】
    　　接骨：狗头一个烧存性为末，热酢调涂，暖卧。 【《易简方》】

    　　一黄散：治打扑伤痕，紫黑有瘀血，流注有热者，大黄为末，姜汁调温敷。[158p]

    For those suffering from severe pain due to sores or injuries from wind or water: burn cow dung to generate smoke and let it enter the body, causing sweating, which will lead to recovery.

    For severe pain from fox urine in sores: soak it with hot white horse urine. Another method: take one part of dried scorpion and musk, grind into powder, and apply to the affected area; the pain will quickly subside.

    　　一白散：治打扑伤痕紫黑，有瘀血流注，无热者，半夏为末，姜汁调敷。　　又方：羊毛饼法，鸡子清、桐油各半打匀，以羊毛薄捻作饼如纸样，贴在患处上，以散血膏或补肉膏敷贴。

    White Powder: For treating bruises that are purple-black, with stagnant blood and no heat, use Banxia powdered, mixed with ginger juice for application.

    　　破伤风如神：用人家粪堆内蛴螬虫一枚，烂草房上亦有之，捏住其脊，待其虫口中吐水，就抹在疮口上，觉麻即汗出立愈。后试之果然。其虫仍埋故处，勿伤其命。【《婴童百问》】
    　　豆淋酒：治金疮中风反强者，大豆六合，鸡矢白一合。　　右炒，令大豆焦黑，次入鸡矢白同炒，乘热泻于三升酒中，密盖良久，滤去滓，每服五合，如人行五里，更一服，汗出佳。未瘥即更作服之，汗出为度。服后宜吃热生姜粥投之。

    　　竹木入肉，针拨不尽者：以人齿垢封之，即不烂也，屡试屡验。 【叶氏《通变要法》】
    　　人咬伤疮：龟板骨、鳖肚骨各一片，烧研敷之。 【《摘元方》】
    　　人咬手指：瓶盛热尿浸一夜，即愈。 【《通变要法》】[160p]

    Tetanus is like magic: Take a larva from a dung heap, and you can also find it on rotting straw. Grip its spine and wait for it to spit water, then smear this on the wound. You will feel a numbness, and sweating will immediately occur, leading to recovery. This has been tested and proven effective. The larva should be returned to its original place without harming it.

    For treating strong reactions from gunshot wounds: Combine yellow soybeans and one measure of chicken feces. Fry the soybeans until they are charred black, then add the chicken feces and continue to fry. After taking, it is advisable to consume hot ginger porridge.

    For maggots developing in rotten gunshot wounds: Use alum and sprinkle it on the wound to kill them instantly.

    　　　　针灸

    　　《素问》云：人有所坠堕，恶血留内，腹中满胀，不得前后，先饮利药。此上伤厥阴之脉，下伤少阴之络，刺足内踝之下，然骨之前血脉出血，刺足跗上动脉；不已，刺三毛上各一痏，见血则已。左刺右，右刺左。善悲惊不乐，刺如右方。　　《灵枢经》云：有所堕坠，恶血留内。有所大怒，气上而不下，积于胁下则伤肝。又中风及有所击仆，若醉入房，汗出当风则伤脾。又头痛不可取于腧者。有所击堕，恶血在内，若肉伤痛未已，可侧刺，不可远取之也。身有所伤血出多及中风寒，若有所坠堕，四肢懈惰不收，名曰体惰，取小腹脐下三结交者，阳明太阴也，脐下三寸关元也。
    　　　　医案

    　　《元史》曰：布智儿从元太祖征回回，身中数矢，血流满体。太祖命取一牛，剖其腹，纳之牛腹中，浸热血内，移时遂苏。
    　　李挺从伯颜征郢州，炮伤左胁，矢贯于胸，几绝，伯颜令剖水牛腹，内其中，良久苏。[161p]

    Acupuncture

    The "Suwen" states: When a person falls or suffers a setback, bad blood remains inside, causing abdominal fullness and swelling, making it difficult to move forward or backward. First, administer beneficial medicine. This affects the Jueyin meridian above and the Shaoyin collateral below. Puncture below the inner ankle of the foot, causing blood to flow from the vessels in front of the bone, and puncture the dorsal artery of the foot. If this does not help, puncture each of the three points on the back of the hand until blood is seen. Puncture the left side for issues on the right, and vice versa. For those who are easily saddened, startled, or unhappy, puncture as per the right side.

    The "Lingshu" states: When there is a fall or setback, bad blood remains inside. If there is great anger, the qi rises without descending, accumulating below the ribs and thus harming the liver. Additionally, a stroke or being hit can occur; for instance, if one is drunk and sweats in the wind, it harms the spleen. Furthermore, headache cannot be treated by meridian points. If struck and there is internal bad blood, and if the pain has not subsided, one can puncture laterally, but not distantly. If the body is injured and there is excessive bleeding due to stroke or cold, if there is a fall, the limbs become weak and slack, termed 'body slack.' Treat the area below the navel, three inches below the navel, which corresponds to the Yangming and Taiyin, and this is the Guanyuan point.

    Medical Cases

    The "History of the Yuan" states: Bu Zhier, under the command of Yuan Taizu, was shot multiple times during a campaign against the Hui people, and his body was filled with blood. Taizu ordered a cow to be taken, its abdomen opened, and the wounded individual placed inside to soak in warm blood. After a while, he recovered.

    Li Ting, under Bie Yan, was wounded in the left ribs by cannonfire and had an arrow penetrate his chest, nearly resulting in death. Bie Yan ordered the abdomen of a water buffalo to be opened, and he was placed inside. After a long time, he recovered.[161p]

    　　《本事方》曰：宣和中有一国医，忽承宣快行押，就一佛剎医内人。医诊视之已昏死矣。问其从人，皆不知病之由，惶恐无地。良久，有二三老内人至，下轿环而泣之，方得其实。云：因蹴秋跹，白空而下，坠死。医者云：打扑损伤，自属外科。欲申明，又恐后时参差不测。再视之，微觉有气。忽忆药囊中有苏合香丸，急取半两于火上焙去脑麝，用酒半升研化灌之，至三更方呻吟，五更下恶血数升，调理数日方瘥。
    　　崔给事顷在泽潞与李抱真作判官，李相方以球杖按球子，其将军以杖相格，乘势不能止，因伤李相拇指，并爪甲劈裂，遽索金刀药裹之，强坐，频索酒，饮至数杯，已过量，而面色愈青，忍痛不止。有军使言取葱新折者，入糖灰火煨热，剥皮擘开，其间有涕，取罨损伤处，仍多煨葱续续取热者，凡三易之，面色却赤，斯须云已不痛。凡十数度易，用热葱并涕裹缠，遂毕席笑语。[162p]

    The "Ben Shi Fang" states: During the Xuanhe era, there was a royal physician in a certain kingdom who abruptly received a summons from the emperor to attend to a Buddhist monk. Upon examination, the physician found that the monk had already succumbed to death. When questioned about the cause of death, the attendants were at a loss and terrified. After a long while, two or three elderly attendants arrived, weeping as they approached the sedan chair, and only then did they reveal the truth: he had fallen while chasing after a butterfly, descending from the white sky, which resulted in his death. The physician explained that the injuries were from a fall and belonged to the category of external injuries. He wanted to clarify further but feared uncertainty in the future. Upon another inspection, he noticed a faint breath. Suddenly, he remembered that he had a scented pill in his medicine pouch. He hurriedly took half a tael and heated it over a fire, removing the brain and musk, then ground it with half a liter of wine to administer. By the third watch of the night, the monk finally moaned in agony, and by the fifth watch, he expelled a large quantity of dark blood. After a few days of treatment, he finally recovered.

    Cui Jishi was recently serving as a judge with Li Baozhen in Zelu. Li Xiang had been striking a ball with a cue when a general inadvertently struck him with his staff, resulting in an injury to Li's thumb, which split his nail. In a hurry, he requested a golden knife and medicine to wrap around it, and despite the pain, he forced himself to sit up and repeatedly asked for wine, drinking several cups. As he consumed too much, his complexion turned increasingly pale, yet he bore the pain without complaint. One soldier suggested using freshly cut green onions, which were then heated over sugar and ashes, peeled, and split open to extract the juice. This was applied to the injury, and the warming of the onions was repeated several times. After three applications, his complexion turned red, and soon after he mentioned that the pain had subsided. They repeated this process over ten times, using the heated onions and their juice, and eventually finished the meal in laughter and conversation.[162p]

    　　《儒门事亲》曰：戴人出游，道经故息城，见一男子被杖，疮痛焮发，毒气人里，惊涎堵塞，牙噤不开，粥药不下，月余，百治无功，甘分于死。戴人先以三圣散吐青苍惊涎，约半大缶；次以利膈丸百余粒，下臭恶燥粪，又一大缶；复煎通圣散数钱热服之，更以酸辣葱酢汤发其汗，斯须吐泻交出，其人活矣。此法可以救免。
    　　《薛己医案》曰：一人患跌扑损伤，两胁胀闷，欲咳不咳，口觉血腥，遍身臀腿胀痛，倦怠不食，烦渴脉大，此血脱烦躁也。与童便酒，及砭患处出死血糜肉甚多，忽发热烦躁汗出，投以独参汤三剂少止；又用补气血清肝火之药数剂，饮食稍进；后用独参汤间服，诸证悉退，饮食顿加，但不能多寐，以归脾汤加山栀、竹茹四剂而熟睡。因劳心遂烦渴自汗，脉大无力，以当归补血汤二剂而安。又以十全大补去川芎，加麦门、五味、牡丹、地骨、麻黄根、炒浮麦，数剂而汗止，死肉且溃，又二十余剂而新肉生。[163p]

    The "Confucian Door to Filial Piety" states: A person from Dai traveled and passed through the old city of Xi. He saw a man beaten with a rod, suffering from painful sores, the poison inside him causing a block in the throat, unable to open his mouth, and unable to take in gruel or medicine. After a month of futile treatments, he resigned himself to death. The man from Dai first used a mixture of Three Holy Powders to expel the greenish bile and blockage in the throat, using about half a large jar. Next, he administered over a hundred pills of a purging medicine to remove the foul, dry filth, which took up another large jar. Then he decocted a few qian of the Tongsheng Powder to be taken hot, followed by a sour, spicy soup with scallions and vinegar to induce sweating. Soon, vomiting and diarrhea occurred, and the man survived. This method can be employed for rescue.

    The "Xue Ji Medical Case" states: A man suffered from injuries caused by a fall, experiencing bloating and pressure in both sides, a desire to cough but could not, a metallic taste in the mouth, swelling and pain throughout the body, fatigue, loss of appetite, and a pronounced thirst with a strong pulse, indicating blood depletion and agitation. He was treated with a mixture of children's urine wine, and while needling the affected area, much dark blood and rotten flesh were drawn out. Suddenly, he experienced fever and agitation with sweating, followed by taking three doses of a single ginseng decoction which slightly mitigated the symptoms. Additional medications to tonify qi and blood and clear liver fire were administered in several doses, allowing for slight improvement in appetite. Later, he continued alternating doses of the single ginseng decoction, leading to the resolution of all symptoms and increased appetite, but he could not sleep well. He used Guizhi Decoction adding gardenia and bamboo shavings in four doses, promoting sound sleep. Due to mental fatigue, he experienced thirst and spontaneous sweating, with a weak, rapid pulse, so he was given two doses of Donggui Decoction to nourish the blood, bringing him stability. He also took a modified version of the Comprehensive Ginseng Decoction, excluding Chuanxiong and adding wheat, five-flavored herbs, peony, earth bone, ma huang root, and fried floating wheat in several doses until sweating ceased, and the necrotic flesh began to ulcerate. After over twenty additional doses, new flesh began to grow.[163p]

    　　一人杖疮，伤处揉散，唯肿痛不消。余日：此瘀血在内，宜急砭之。不从。余以萝卜自然汁调山栀末敷之，破处以当归膏贴之，更服活血之剂而瘥。数年之后，但遇天阴，仍作痒痛，始知不砭之失。
    　　一患者臀腿黑肿而皮不破，但胀痛重坠，皆以为内无瘀血，惟敷凉药可以止痛。余诊其尺脉濇而结，此因体肥肉厚，瘀血畜深，刺去即愈，否则内溃，有烂筋伤骨之患。余人针四寸，出黑血数升，肿痛遂止。是日发热恶寒，烦渴头痛，此气血俱虚而然也，以十全大补之剂，遂瘥。
    　　一患者杖后服四物、红花、桃仁、大黄等剂以逐瘀血，腹反痛；更服一剂，痛益甚，按其腹不痛。余日：此血虚也，故喜按而不痛，宜温补之剂，遂以归身、白朮、参、芪、炙草二剂，痛即止。[164p]

    A person has a wound from a stick. The injured area is swollen and painful, but the pain doesn't subside. I said: "The stagnant blood is inside; it should be urgently needled." However, they did not follow my advice. I used the natural juice of a radish mixed with powdered mountain gardenia to apply to the wound, then covered it with angelica ointment and prescribed blood-activating medicine, which resulted in healing. Years later, whenever the weather was gloomy, they experienced itching and pain, finally realizing the mistake of not being needled.

    Another patient had black swelling on the buttock and thigh, but the skin was unbroken. There was heaviness and pain, leading them to believe there was no stagnant blood inside, thinking that only cooling medicine could relieve the pain. On examining their pulse, it was thin and knotty, indicating deep stagnant blood due to their thick flesh. Without needling, it would worsen, risking internal decay and injury to tendons and bones. I needled four inches deep and extracted several liters of black blood, after which the swelling and pain ceased. That day, they experienced fever and chills, thirst, and headaches, due to both Qi and blood deficiency; a restorative tonic was then administered, and they recovered.

    Another patient, after being beaten, took herbal preparations including Four Substances, safflower, peach kernel, and rhubarb to disperse stagnant blood, which instead caused abdominal pain. After administering another dose, the pain worsened, yet pressing on the abdomen did not elicit pain. I noted: "This indicates blood deficiency, hence the relief when pressed. They should take warming and nourishing medicines." Therefore, I prescribed angelica, white atractylodes, ginseng, astragalus, and two doses of honey-fried licorice, resulting in the pain stopping immediately.[164p]

    　　一患者瘀血已去，饮食少思，死肉不溃，又用托里之药，脓稍溃而清，此血气虚也，非大补不可。彼不从。余强用大补之剂，饮食进而死肉溃；但少寐，以归脾汤加山栀二剂而寐。因劳心烦躁作渴，脉浮洪大，以当归补血汤二剂而安。
    　　一患者受刑太重，外皮伤破，瘀血如注，内肉糜烂黯肿，上干胸背，下至足指，昏愤不食，随以黑羊皮热贴患处，灌以童便酒薄粥，更以清肝活血调气健脾之剂，神思稍苏，始言遍身强痛；又用大剂养血补气之药，肿消食进。时仲冬瘀血凝结，不能溃脓，又用大补之剂壮其阳气，其脓方熟，遂砭去，洞见其骨，涂以当归膏，及服前药百余剂，肌肉渐生。

    　　一患者服行气之剂，胸痞气促，食少体倦，色黯脓清，此形气俱虚之证也。先用六君、桔梗二剂，胸膈气和；后用补中益气去升麻，加茯苓、半夏、五味、麦门治之，元气渐复而愈。若用前剂，戕贼元气，多致不救。

    　　有一患者，腹胀喘促，作渴寒热，臀腿糜烂，与死血相和，如皮囊盛糊，用童便煎四物、桃仁、红花、柴胡、黄芩、麦门、花粉，服之顿退。彼用黑羊皮贴之益甚，后砭去脓血甚多，气息奄奄，唇口微动，牙关紧急，患处色黯，或欲用破伤风药。余曰：此气血虚而变证也。用参、芪、芎、归、白朮，并独参汤、人乳汁，元气复而诸证愈，仍用十全大补汤调理而安。此证若脓瘀内焮者，宜针之。若溃后口噤遗尿而类破伤风等证者，乃气血虚极也，急用大补之剂。若素多痰患风证者，宜清痰降火。若因怒而见风证者，宜清肝降火。若人不慎房劳而忽患前证，此由肾水不足，心火炽甚，宜滋阴补气血为主。若误作风证治之，即死。[168p]
