I used needles to extract over three bowls of foul pus, and he exhibited all signs of deficiency. A strong tonic was administered, and after over two months he regained some ability to walk. However, due to mental strain, his hands became shaky, his eyes opened, and he sweated profusely, leading him to consider using medicines to expel wind. I said: This indicates that his qi and blood are still insufficient. Hence, I urgently warmed and frequently pressed his navel and the Qi Hai point with moxibustion. I decocted four taels of Ren Shen and five qian of Fu Zi for administration. After a while, there was slight movement in the arm; another dose was given, and he could open his eyes and speak, though his breath could not stabilize. I then combined Ren Shen, Qi, Gui, and Zhu, totaling one pound, with five qian of Fu Zi, decocted in water, and he took it gradually. His vital energy gradually recovered, his appetite returned, and he was able to discontinue Fu Zi as the wound healed.[173p]

    　　一女子年十七，闪右臂微肿作痛，寅申时发热，余决其胆经血虚火盛，经水果先期而至，先以四物合小柴胡汤四剂，热退；更以加味四物汤加香附、地骨皮、山栀各五分，芩、连、炙草各三分，二十余剂，其肿亦消；乃去黄连、山栀，又五十余剂，经水调而元气充矣。
    　　儒者王清之跌腰作痛，用定痛等药不愈，气血日衰，面耳黧色。余曰：腰为肾之腑，虽曰闪伤，实肾经虚弱所致。遂用杜仲、补骨脂、五味、山萸、蓰蓉、山药，空心服；又以六君、当归、白朮、神曲各二钱，食远服，不日而瘥。[174p]

    A girl of seventeen had a slight swelling and pain in her right arm. At the hours of Yin and Shen, she experienced fever, and I determined that her gallbladder meridian was affected due to a deficiency of blood and an excess of internal heat. Her menstrual flow arrived earlier than expected. Initially, I prescribed four doses of a combination of Siwu Decoction and Xiao Chaihu Decoction, which alleviated the fever. I then added a modified Siwu Decoction including five grams each of Xiangfu, Diguo Pi, and Zhizi, and three grams each of Qinchao, Lianhua, and roasted licorice, using over twenty doses, which resolved the swelling. I then removed Huanglian and Zhizi, administering over fifty additional doses, and her vital energy was restored.

    The Confucian scholar Wang Qingzhi suffered from pain in his lower back due to a sprain. Despite using pain relief medications, he did not improve; his qi and blood were increasingly depleting, and his face and ears had darkened. I remarked that the lower back is related to the kidneys. Although he claimed it was a sprain, it was actually a result of weakness in the kidney meridian. Therefore, I prescribed a mixture of Du Zhong, Bu Guo Zi, Wu Wei Zi, Shan Yao, and Xianrong to be taken on an empty stomach. I also prescribed six herbs: Ren Shen, Dang Gui, Bai Zhu, and Shen Qu, each at two qian, to be taken away from meals. Soon after, he was healed.[174p]

    　　一三岁儿闪腰作痛，服流气等药半载不愈。余曰：此禀肾气不足，不治之证也。后果殁。
    　　云间曹子容为室人中风灌药，误咬去指半节，焮痛寒热，外敷大黄等药，内服清热败毒，患处不痛不溃，脓清，寒热愈甚。余曰：此因凉药遏绝隧道而然也。遂敷玉龙膏以散寒气，更服六君子汤以壮脾胃。数日后，患处微痛，肿处渐消，此阳气运达患处也，果出稠脓，不数日，半指溃脱，更服托里药而敛。
    　　上舍王天爵汤足焮肿，内热作渴，外敷内服，皆寒凉败毒，患处益肿而不溃，且恶寒少食，欲作呕吐。余曰：此气血俱虚，又因寒药凝结隧道，损伤胃气，以致前证耳。遂用香砂六君子、芎、归、炮姜，外证悉退。唯体倦晡热，饮食不甘，以补中益气汤加地骨皮、五味、麦门，治之而愈。[175p]

    A three-year-old child suffered from waist pain and did not heal after taking various medications for half a year. I said: This is due to a deficiency of kidney energy, an incurable condition. Eventually, the child passed away.

    In another case, a person named Cao Ziyong suffered a stroke and accidentally bit off part of his finger while taking medicine. He experienced pain, cold, and fever, and external treatments with Da Huang and other medicines, along with internal administration of heat-clearing and toxin-eliminating remedies, led to no pain and no abscess, but the symptoms worsened. I said: This is due to the cooling medicines obstructing the channels. So, I applied Yulong ointment to disperse the cold and additionally prescribed Liu Junzi decoction to strengthen the spleen and stomach. After a few days, there was slight pain at the affected area, and the swelling gradually diminished, indicating the movement of Yang energy to the area, eventually leading to the discharge of thick pus. Within a few days, half of the finger became necrotic, and I prescribed medicines to assist detoxification and encourage healing.

    Another case involved a patient named Wang Tianjue, who experienced significant swelling and inner heat leading to thirst. Both internal and external treatments with cold and toxin-eliminating remedies caused further swelling without an abscess and resulted in chills, poor appetite, and nausea. I said: This condition is due to both Qi and blood deficiency, and the cold medicines have coagulated the channels, harming the stomach's energy, which leads to the previous symptoms. Therefore, I used Xiangsha Liu Junzi, Chuanxiong, Angelica, and Paojiang, and the external symptoms receded completely. However, the patient felt fatigued with a slight afternoon fever and showed poor appetite, which I treated with the Baizhong Yiqi decoction, adding mudanpi, Wuweizi, and Maimendong, resulting in recovery.[175p]

    　　　外科虫兽伤门

    　　　　千金方 【唐　孙思邈】

    　　　　　总论

    　　凡见一切毒螫之物，必不得起恶心向之，亦不得杀之。若辄杀之，于后必遭螫毒，治亦难瘥。慎之慎之！
    　　　　　狂犬

    　　凡春末夏初，犬多发狂，必诫小弱持杖以预防。防而不免者，莫出于灸。百日之中，一日不阙者，方得免难。若初见疮瘥痛定，即言平复者，此最可畏。大祸即至，死在旦夕。凡狂犬咬人着讫，即令人狂，精神已别，何以得知？但看灸时一度火下，即觉心中醒然，惺惺了了，方知咬已即狂，是以深须知此。此病至重，世皆轻之，不以为意，坐是死者，常年有。吾初学医，未以为业，有人遭此，将以见问，吾了不知报答，以是经吾手而死者不一。[176p]

    Wounds from Insects and Beasts

    From the book "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" by Sun Simiao (Tang Dynasty)

    General Discussion

    Whenever encountering any poisonous creatures or stings, one must not develop a revulsion towards them or kill them. If one rashly kills them, later one will surely suffer from the poison of the sting, and treatment will be difficult. Be cautious, be cautious!

    Rabies

    In late spring and early summer, when dogs frequently go mad, one must admonish the weak and small to carry a stick for protection. If one tries to prevent an attack and fails, it will not exceed the remedy of moxibustion. Among a hundred days, if there is not a single day missed, then one may escape disaster. If, upon first encountering a wound, it seems to heal without pain, and one thinks it has recovered, this is the most terrifying sign. Great calamity will arise, and death will come unexpectedly. Whenever a rabid dog bites someone, it causes that person to become mad as well; their spirit has already become detached, how can one be aware? Just watch closely; if during moxibustion the fire is applied for one degree, and the heart feels distinctly awake and clear, then one realizes that once bitten, one is indeed mad, thus it is imperative to understand this deeply. This illness is severe, yet many in the world treat it lightly and do not regard it seriously, which leads to deaths occurring regularly. When I first learned medicine, I did not take it up professionally; there were those who encountered this ailment but when they consulted me, I genuinely did not know how to respond, resulting in several patients dying under my care.[176p]

    自此锐意学之，一解已来，治者皆愈。方知世无良医，枉死者半，此言非虚。故将来学者，非止此法。余医方皆须沉思，留心作意，殷勤学之，乃得通晓。莫以初解一两种法，即谓知讫，极自误也。　　凡猘犬咬人，七日辄应一发，三七日不发则脱也，要过百日，乃得免耳。每到七日，辄当捣韭汁饮之一二升，又当终身禁食犬肉蚕蛹，食此则发，死不可救矣。疮未愈之间，禁食生鱼及诸肥腻冷食，但于饭下蒸鱼，及于肥器中食便发。不宜饮酒，能过一年乃佳。[177p]

    From this point on, I resolutely dedicated myself to study, and having solved it, all those in charge became better. It became evident that there are no good doctors in the world, and those who die wrongfully are many; this is not an exaggeration. Therefore, future learners should not stop at this method. I believe all medical prescriptions must be contemplated deeply, attentively studied, and earnestly learned to gain thorough understanding. One should not think that knowing one or two methods is sufficient; that would be a great self-deception.

    Whenever a dog bites a person, symptoms should appear within seven days; if they do not appear after twenty-one days, then the person is in the clear but should still be cautious for over a hundred days. Every seven days, one should drink one to two sheng of leek juice, and one should avoid eating dog meat and silkworm pupae for life; consuming these will provoke the disease, leading to inevitable death. While the wound is not healed, one should refrain from eating raw fish and all rich, cold foods; it is fine to eat steamed fish with rice, but not from rich dishes. Drinking alcohol should be avoided, ideally for over a year.[177p]

    　　　　　蠼螋

    　　凡蠼螋尿人影着处，便令人病疮。其状身中忽有处瘳痛如芒刺，亦如刺虫所螫，后起细(疒咅)(疒畾)，作聚如茱萸子状，四边赤，中央有白脓如黍粟，亦令人皮肉急，举身恶寒壮热，剧者连起竟腰胁胸也。治之法，初得之，磨犀角涂之，止其毒，治如火丹法。余以武德中六月得此疾，经五六日，觉心闷不佳，以他法治不愈。又有人教画地作蠼螋形，以刀子细细尽取蠼螋腹中土，就中以唾和成泥涂之，再涂即愈。方知天下万物相感，莫晓其由。
    　　　　　射工[178p]

    The Qusheng (a type of insect)

    Whenever the shadow of the Qusheng urinates on someone, it causes diseases and sores. Its symptoms include sudden sharp pains in the body, akin to a thorn prick or the sting of an insect, followed by the emergence of small bumps that appear like the seeds of a berry, with red edges and a center filled with white pus resembling millet, causing intense pain to the flesh. The body experiences severe chills and high fever, with serious cases affecting the waist, sides, and chest.

    The treatment method, upon first noticing the illness, is to grind rhino horn and apply it to stop the poison, treating it as one would with fire elixirs. During the Wude period in June, I contracted this ailment. After five to six days, I felt unsettled and my condition did not improve with other treatments. Someone else advised me to draw the shape of the Qusheng on the ground and carefully remove the soil from its abdomen with a knife, mixing it with saliva to make a paste and applying it. After reapplying, I was cured. This illustrates the interconnectedness of all things in the world, though the reasons remain unknown.[178p]

    　　江南有射工毒虫，一名短狐，一名蜮。其虫形如甲虫《外台》云：正黑，状如大蜚[蜚　原本「飞」，掳《外台秘要》改。]，生有一长角，在口前，如弩檐，临其角端，曲如上弩，以气为矢，因水势以射人。人或闻其在水中铋铋作声，须要得水没其口，便射人。其虫畏鹅，鹅能食之。其初始证候，先恶寒噤，(疒叅)寒热筋急，仍似伤寒，亦如中尸，便不能语，朝旦小苏，哺夕辄剧，寒热闷乱，是其证。始得三四日，当急治之。治之稍迟者，七日皆死。初未有疮，但恶寒噤(疒叅)；及成疮似蠼螋尿，亦似瘭疽疮。射工中疮有三种：其一种疮正黑如黛子，皮周边悉赤，或衣犯之如有芒刺痛；其一种作疮，久久穿，或晡间寒热；其一种如火灼熛起，似此者最急，数日杀人。　　凡山水有毒虫，人涉水，中人如射工而无物。诊法，初得之恶寒，微似头痛，目眶痛，心中烦懊，四肢振焮，腰背百节背强，两膝痛；或翕翕而热，但欲睡，旦醒暮剧，手足逆冷。[179p]

    In Jiangnan, there is a type of poisonous insect known as the short fox or the tian. This insect resembles a beetle. According to "Wai Tai," it is pitch black, shaped like a large flying insect, with a long horn extending from its mouth, resembling the yoke of a crossbow. At the end of this horn, it curves like a bent bow, using air as an arrow to attack people based on the water's force. Sometimes, people hear it making a noise in the water and must fully submerge its mouth in water to attack. It is afraid of geese, which can eat it.

    Initially, when symptoms appear, there are chills and shivering, with alternating hot and cold sensations, resembling a cold or being struck down. The person may be unable to speak, feeling slightly better in the morning but worsening in the evening, suffering from chaotic chills and heat. These are the symptoms. If not treated promptly within three to four days, those infected easily succumb by the seventh day. At first, there are no sores, but only the chills and shivering. Eventually, sores form that resemble a mix of weevil and urine, similar to boils and sores. There are three types of sores caused by this insect: one is dark black like a dye, with surrounding skin entirely red, which might feel prickly as if pierced by thorns; another type develops into a sore that persists for a long time, accompanied by intermittent chills and fever; the third type appears as if burned with fire and is the most urgent, killing within several days.

    Whenever one encounters toxic insects in mountainous waters, those wading through might be affected like a shooting victim without a weapon. The diagnostic method involves initial chills, mild headache, pain around the eyes, inner agitation, shaking of the limbs, tightness in the waist and back, and pain in the knees. They may also experience alternating feelings of heat and cold, with an overwhelming desire to sleep, waking up with severe symptoms in the evening, and cold extremities.[179p]

    二三日，腹中生虫，食人下部，肛中有疮，不痛不痒，令人不觉。不急治，遇六七日，下部出脓溃，虫上食人五脏，热盛毒烦，下利不禁。八九日，虽良医不能治矣。觉得之，急早视其下部，若有疮正赤如截肉者，为阳毒，最急；若疮如鲤鱼齿者，为阴毒，犹小缓。要皆杀人，－不过二十日也。欲知是中水与非者，当作五六升汤，以小蒜五升(口父)咀投汤中，消息勿令大热，去滓以浴之，是水毒身体当发赤斑，无异者非也，当以他病治之。[180p]

    In two or three days, worms develop in the abdomen, feeding on the lower parts of the body, leading to sores in the anus that are painless and itchless, causing the person to remain unaware. If not treated urgently, after six or seven days, pus will emerge from the lower parts, the worms will start to eat the organs, and intense heat and toxins will lead to uncontrollable diarrhea. After eight or nine days, even skilled doctors will be unable to treat it. When recognized, one must examine the lower parts urgently; if there are sores that are bright red as if cut meat, this indicates Yang poison and is most urgent; if the sores resemble fish teeth, this indicates Yin poison and can be treated with less urgency. Both can be deadly, but not exceeding twenty days. To determine whether it is water poison or not, one should prepare five to six liters of broth, adding five liters of crushed garlic into the broth, ensuring it does not get too hot, and then straining it for bathing. If the body exhibits red spots due to the water poison, this confirms it; otherwise, it must be treated for another ailment.[180p]

    　　江东江南诸溪源问有虫，名短狐溪毒，亦名射工。其虫无目而利耳能听，在山源溪水中，闻人声，便以口中毒射人，故谓射工也。其虫小毒轻者，及相逐者，射着人影者，皆不即作疮，先病寒热，身不喜冷，体强筋急，头痛目疼，张口欠咳，呼吸闷乱，朝旦少苏醒，晡夕辄复寒热，或以伤寒发石散动，亦如中尸，便不能语，病候如此。自非其土地人，不常数行山水中，不知其证，便谓是伤寒发石散动，作治乖僻。毒盛发疮，复疑是瘭疽；乃至吐下去血，复恐疑蛊毒，是以至祸耳。今说其状类，以明其证与伤寒别也。[181p]

    In the streams and sources of Jiangdong and Jiangnan, there is a worm known as the Short Fox Worm, also called the Shooting Worker. This worm is blind but has keen hearing; found in mountain springs and streams, it can detect human voices and shoots poison from its mouth, hence the name Shooting Worker. For those affected by this small, mildly toxic worm, when pursued, and if the worm hits a person's shadow, it does not immediately cause sores. Instead, symptoms appear first with chills and fever; the body dislikes the cold, physical strength may seem tense, headaches and eye pain occur, and there may be a constant cough with labored breathing. In the morning, there may be brief recovery, only to return to chills and fever in the evenings. Sometimes, when afflicted with cold damage, a person may feel as if struck by a corpse, becoming unable to speak, and the symptoms persist in this manner. Those unfamiliar with the local landscape, who do not frequently wander in mountain waters, may mistake these signs for cold damage from external forces, leading to improper treatments. As the poison intensifies and sores develop, it may further be mistaken for swellings; to the extent that nausea and vomiting of blood occurs, they might even fear it to be sorcery or poison, resulting in serious troubles. Now, this description delineates its characteristics to clarify its symptoms from those of cold damage.[181p]

    　　　　证治要诀 【明　戴思恭】

    　　　　　恶虫蛇伤

    　　为恶虫蛇所伤，用白芷细嚼敷患处，仍以酒调芷末服。蜈蚣伤用鸡屎涂。(虫修)伤用蕨萁芒烧灰，香油调敷。犬伤用虎骨末敷。猫伤用薄荷揩。蜂虿伤用人参嚼而敷之；或用诸蟹壳烧存性研末，蜜调敷。凡诸恶物伤，急于伤处灼艾数壮，亦佳。
    　　　　薛氏医案 【明　薛己】

    　　　　　误吞水蛭

    　　治误吞水蛭，食蜜即愈。试以活蛭投蜜中，即化为水，屡验。一书云：井中生蛭，以白马骨投之，即无。试之亦验。夫蛭即蚂蝗也，虽死为末，见水复活，人吞之为害不小，治以前法，无不愈者。[182p]

    Essentials of Diagnosis and Treatment 【Ming Dynasty - Dai Sigong】

    Injury from Poisonous Insects and Snakes

    For injuries caused by poisonous insects and snakes, chew white atractylodes finely and apply it to the wound, and also take it mixed with alcohol. For centipede injuries, apply chicken droppings. For worm injuries, use the burnt ash of fern leaves mixed with fragrant oil for application. For dog bites, use ground tiger bone. For cat bites, apply mint. For bee and scorpion stings, chew ginseng and apply it, or use ground crab shells, burnt to retain their essence, mixed with honey for application. In all cases of injury from vicious creatures, it is also good to quickly cauterize the wound with moxa a few times.

    Xue's Medical Cases 【Ming Dynasty - Xue Ji】

    Accidental Swallowing of Leeches

    To treat the accidental swallowing of leeches, consuming honey can lead to recovery. If live leeches are thrown into honey, they will dissolve into liquid, as repeatedly observed. One book states that leeches found in wells can be eliminated by throwing in white horse bones, which has also been tested successfully. Leeches, or bloodsuckers, even if dead and ground to powder, can come back to life upon contact with water. Their ingestion can be quite harmful, and the aforementioned treatment has always been effective.[182p]

    　　　　　蛇入七窍

    　　凡蛇入七窍，劈开蛇尾，纳川椒数粒，以纸封之，其蛇自出。更煎人参汤饮之；或饮酒食蒜，以攻内毒。如被蛇咬，食蒜饮酒；更用蒜杵烂涂患处，加艾于蒜上灸之，其毒自解。凡毒虫伤并效。
    　　　　证治准绳 【明　王肯堂】

    　　　　　毛虫证治

    　　春夏月树下坛堑间，有一等杂色毛虫，极毒，凡人触著者，则放毛入人手足上，自皮至肉，自肉至骨。其初皮肉微痒，以渐至痛，经数日痒在外而痛在内，用手抓搔，或痒或痛，必致骨肉皆烂，有性命之忧。此名中射工毒，诸药不效。用好豆豉约一碗，清油半盏，拌豉捣烂，厚敷痛痒处，经一时久，豉气透骨，则引出虫毛，纷纷可见。取下豆豉，埋在土中。煎香白芷汤洗痛处。如肉已烂，用海螵蛸即鰞鲗鱼骨为末敷之，愈。　　治刺蝥伤，无如甘草妙。口内细嚼敷之，即时愈。今苏州虎丘山下民家，皆以种植树木为生，周十里内无蝥，乃时用甘草汁洒树故也。[183p]

    Snake Enters the Seven Orifices

    Whenever a snake enters the seven orifices, split the snake's tail and insert several grains of Sichuan pepper, sealing it with paper. The snake will exit on its own. Then brew and drink ginseng broth; alternatively, consume wine and garlic to combat internal toxins. If bitten by a snake, eat garlic and drink wine; also use crushed garlic to apply to the wound and combine it with moxa for cauterization; the poison will be naturally resolved. This applies to all cases of venomous insect bites.

    Treatment of Caterpillar Injury

    In spring and summer months, beneath trees and in the gaps, there exists a type of striped caterpillar, which is extremely toxic. If a person makes contact, its hairs penetrate into the skin and flesh, reaching the bones. Initially, there may be slight itching on the skin, which gradually turns into pain; after several days, the external itching persists while internal pain develops. Scratching can worsen the condition, potentially leading to rotting flesh and a threat to life. This is known as the poison of the penetrating worker, and no medications are effective.

    Use about a bowl of good fermented soybeans and half a cup of clear oil, mix and mash the soybeans, and apply a thick layer to the painful and itchy areas. After some time, the bean scent will reach the bones and draw out the caterpillar hairs, which will be visible. After removing the soybeans, bury them in the ground. Boil fragrant white angelica soup to wash the painful areas. If the flesh has already rotted, use crushed cuttlefish bone or fishbone as a powder to apply, and it will heal. For injuries from insects, licorice works wonders. Chew finely and apply it to the mouth for immediate relief. In present-day Suzhou, beneath Tiger Hill, local families depend on planting trees, and there are no insects within a ten-mile radius, likely due to the use of licorice juice to sprinkle on the trees.[183p]

    　　　　石室秘箓 【清　陈士铎】
    　　　　　　　虫兽治法
    　　世人被虎咬伤，血必大出，其伤口立时溃烂，其疼不可忍，当急用猪肉贴之，随贴随化，随化随易；连用地榆一斤为细末，加入三七根末三两，苦参末四两，和匀掺之，随湿随掺，血即止而痛即定。盖地榆凉血，苦参止痛，三七根末止血，合三者之长，故奏功实神
    　　　　方

    　　雄黄消毒膏 【《宝鉴》】 　治蝎螫不可忍。　　雄黄　信各半两　巴豆三钱　白矾生，一两　　右为细末，黄蜡半两，镕开入药搅匀，为锭子如枣子大。用时将锭子签于灯焰上炙开，滴于螫着处，其痛立止。
    　　一上散　治蝎螫痛。
    　　半夏一字，生用为细末　雄黄一字，另研细　巴豆一个，去皮如泥　　右三味，同研和匀上之。[184p]

    Stone Chamber's Secret Prescriptions
    [Qing Dynasty - Chen Shiduo]
    Treatment for Insect and Animal Bites
    When a person is bitten by a tiger, blood will flow profusely, and the wound will immediately fester, causing unbearable pain. Quickly use pork to apply to the wound; as the meat melts, replace it frequently. Additionally, use one pound of earthworm finely ground, combined with three taels of the root of Notopterygium, and four taels of Sofu, mix well. Apply as needed; the bleeding will stop and the pain will subside. Earthworm cools the blood, Sofu alleviates pain, and the root of Notopterygium stops bleeding; the combination of these three ingredients is therefore remarkably effective.

    Realgar Disinfectant Ointment
    [From "Precious Mirror"]
    For intolerable scorpion stings:
    Realgar, ½ tael; 3 qian of Croton; 1 tael of raw alum.
    Grind these into a fine powder. Mix with ½ tael of yellow wax, melt together, and form small pills the size of jujubes. When using, hold the pill in the flame until heated, then apply the melted ointment to the sting; the pain will stop immediately.

    First Powder
    For pain from scorpion stings:
    One character of Pinellia, finely ground; one character of Realgar, ground separately; one Croton (peeled) turned to paste. Mix these three ingredients together thoroughly.[184p]

    Holy Remedies for Snake Bites and Scorpion Stings

    For treating snake bites and scorpion stings, the method is remarkable:

    • Three qians of realgar, one qian of faith (or trust), and forty-nine grains each of soapberry and purgative bean; a small amount of earplug and musk.
      On May 5, in a place without the sounds of chickens, dogs, or women, without speaking, pound into a fine powder, seal it in an apricot kernel, and prick out the painful area with a needle for significant effect.

    For treating injuries from venomous snakes:

    • Five qians each of asarum and fragrant white artemisia, and two qians of realgar.
      Grind into a powder, add a small amount of musk, and take two qians with warm wine for effect.

    For various snake bites, apply this to the person who has captured the snake. The medicinal properties are effective even if not complete:

    • Ingredients include large and small indigo, fragrant wood, leaves of the black oak, fire-cooked grass, mountain fern flesh, mountain dragon, earth centipede, asparagus, white peony, and fragrant herb.
      Grind these into a fine powder, mix with fragrant wood and dilute with raw white wine. Apply the residue to the bite area for cumulative effect.

    Cicada Flower Powder for dog bites in summer and various injuries, especially in cases of severe maggot infestation, where the stench is unbearable:

    • One ounce of snake cicada skin, burnt until it is charred. Half an ounce each of cicada shell and indigo, and two and a half qians of asarum.
      Grind into a fine powder, take three qians mixed with wine. If livestock are injured and develop sores, administer with wine. For dog bites, mix with fermented dough; it will turn all maggots into water, and flies will not dare to land again. Additionally, mix with dry powedered cold-water stone.[185p]

    　　定风散　治风犬咬，先口噙浆水洗净，用绵拭干，贴药，更不再发，大有神效。　　生天南星　防风各等分
    　　右为细末，干上，更不再发，无脓，效不可具述。
    　　扶危散　治狂犬伤，出毒法。
    　　防风五钱螌蝥一钱　麝香三分　雄黄二钱　大黄　黑牵牛头末各三钱　　右为末，每二钱滚水调服，恶物从小便而出。又生麻油研豆豉为膏，丸如弹子大，常揩拭所咬处，却掐开看豉丸内，若有狗毛茸茸然，此毒气已出，掐至无茸毛，方为痊可。
    　　扶危散　治风狗咬。
    　　螌蝥七日内用七个，七日外每日加一个，十日十个，百日百个，去翅足与糯米同炒　滑石一两　雄黄一钱　麝香一字　　右为末，温酒调服。不饮酒者，米饮下。毒从大小便出，即愈。[186p]

    Ding Feng San (Settling Wind Powder): For treating dog bites, first rinse the mouth with a wash of water and syrup, dry it with cotton, and apply medicine. If there are no further outbreaks, the effect is remarkable.

    Sheng Tian Nan Xing (生天南星): For preventing wind in equal parts.

    The right-hand side is finely powdered, applied dry, with no further outbreaks, no pus; the effectiveness is beyond description.

    Fu Wei San (扶危散): For treating rabid dog bites, expelling poison.

    Ingredients: Five grams of Fangfeng, one gram of Hanmao, three grams of musk, two grams of realgar, three grams each of rhubarb and black morning glory seed powder. The right side is powdered; mix two grams with boiling water to take. The evil substances will escape through urine. Additionally, blend sesame oil and fermented soybean into a paste, form into balls the size of pellets, regularly apply to the bitten area. Squeeze open the paste; if there are dog hairs within, the poison is expelled. Only when there are no hairs can one consider the treatment successful.

    Fu Wei San (扶危散): For treating dog bites from wind.

    For the Hanmao, use seven in the first seven days, increasing by one each following day, totaling ten in ten days and one hundred in one hundred days. Remove wings and feet, frying together with glutinous rice. One tael of talcum and one gram of realgar.

    The right side is powdered; mix with warm wine to take. For those who do not drink wine, use rice beverage. The poison will exit through urine, leading to recovery.[186p]

    　　五神散　搽一切瘴毒蛇伤蝎螫，大效。　　金线钓壶卢　紫河车各二钱　续随子去壳　雄黄各一钱　麝香少许　　右末，酢调涂患处。蛇伤以刀割去损肉，以末干搽，或以唾调搽。或加骑蛇狮子根叶同煎捣用，亦妙。　　又方　治前证。

    　　右二味(口父)咀，以水三升，煮取一升，适寒温尽服，滓薄上。
    　　五香散　治江南毒气恶核，射工中人，暴肿生疮。　　甲香　犀角　鳖甲　升麻　熏陆香　乌翣　丁香　沉香　黄连　青木香　羚羊角　黄芩　甘草　牡蛎各四分

    Wushen Powder: This can be applied to all miasmas, snake bites, and scorpion stings, proving greatly effective.

    Ingredients:

    • Gold thread (two qian)
    • Dried purple river vehicle (two qian)
    • Dried seeds of the continued-following plant (one qian, after removing the shell)
    • Realgar (one qian)
    • Musk (a small amount)

    Grind these ingredients into powder and mix with vinegar to apply to the affected area. For snake bites, cut away the damaged flesh with a knife, apply the powder dry, or mix with saliva for application. Alternatively, you can add roots and leaves of the riding snake lion and use them in a decoction; this approach is also effective.

    • Three liang of black fan root

    　　野葛膏　治射工恶核，卒中恶毒。

    Wild Kudzu Ointment treats poisonous nodes caused by arrows, and those afflicted by malevolent illnesses.

    Ingredients:

    • Wild kudzu (1 sheng)
    • Croton seeds
    • Aconite
    • Sichuan pepper (5 he each)
    • Indian breadroot
    • Prepared aconite
    • Cinnabar (1 tael each)
    • Realgar
    • Rhubarb (7 taels each)

    Combine the ten ingredients to make a mixture that does not include water, with three jin of pig’s gallbladder fat. Boil it three times, removing the dregs, then add the powders of cinnabar and realgar and mix until it solidifies. Shape it to the size of a jujube pit and apply to the painful area, avoiding the eyes. All ointments with this name should not be seen by mothers, women, children, or household animals; they should only be handled when clean.

    Another formula treats those suddenly poisoned by water, with cold hands and feet, or even up to the elbows and knees.

    Ingredients:

    • Wu Zhu Yu (1 sheng)
    • Fresh ginger (1.5 sheng, chopped)
    • Rhinoceros horn
    • Cimicifuga
    • Orange peel (2 taels each)
    • Dried black plums (14 pieces)

    The six ingredients are crushed and boiled in seven sheng of water to yield two sheng of decoction, divided into two doses.

    Another formula treats "cat demons" that are seen or heard.

    Ingredients:

    • Soursop seeds
    • Castor bean seeds
    • Croton seeds (7 each)
    • Cinnabar powder (2 zhu)
    • Wax (4 zhu)

    Combine the five ingredients and pound them into pills. First, take a pill the size of a castor bean and hold it in your mouth. Then, encircle the afflicted person with ash, placing a bucket of ash and kindling it in front, waiting for the fire to extinguish the medicine. Once boiling, mark a cross in the ash; all “cat demons” will perish.

    Tiger injuries: Apply mashed beetles to the wound, daily.

    Horse bite resulting in swollen pain: Use chicken comb blood to apply; use a hen for female horses and a rooster for male horses. Another remedy: finely chop motherwort, mix it with vinegar, and fry before applying. Another remedy: Cook and eat purslane. Another remedy: Burn and grind a single chestnut to apply. This also applies to injuries from bear and tiger claws.

    Horse bite resulting in swelling and heat: Use 27 pieces of mouse droppings, mix with five inches of horse sheath, grind, and apply with pig fat.

    Pig bite wounds: Grind turtle shells, mix with fragrant oil and apply. Another remedy: Refine pine resin into a cake and apply.

    Tiger and dog bites: Grind chives to extract juice, drink one liter three times a day, and apply the residue to the wound.

    Injuries from tigers and wolves: Eat raw chicken meat; also drink raw kudzu juice, and wash the wound. Additionally, for women experiencing menstruation wearing red garments, burn them to ash and mix with wine to consume.

    For cattle that have caused intestinal protrusion without damage: Quickly transport to a facility, using mulberry bark tips or raw white hemp as thread to suture the abdomen, and apply powdered blood stop or powdered herbs on the stitches to stop bleeding and ensure survival. Alternatively, seal the wound, being cautious of internal pus formation.[191p]

    　　胁破肠出臭秽：急以香油摸肠，用手送入，煎人参、地骨皮汤淋之，皮自合，吃羊肉羹，十日愈。
    　　凡春夏初交，犬多发狂，但见其尾直下不卷，口中流涎舌黑者，即是狂犬。若被其伤，乃九死一生之患。急用针刺去血，以人小便洗净，用核桃壳半边，以人粪填满，掩其疮上，着艾灸之，壳焦粪干则易之，灸至百壮；次日，又灸百壮。灸至三五百壮为佳。【《千金》】　　又方：先口噙浆水洗净，或以热人尿淋咬处，嚼生姜擦之，又用葱白嚼烂涂之，又杏仁嚼碎敷之，以帛系定。或用马蔺根研细，葱汤洗后涂之，尤妙。【《纲目》】　　又方：于患人顶心中，有一红发，即当拔之，后服药快效。 【《十三方》】
    　　犬咬人久不差，口吐白沫者，为大毒入心，叫唤似犬声，天灵盖烧灰，东流水调服一钱。【《本草》】
    　　狗咬伤疮烂：嚼杏仁涂之。 【寇氏】　　又方：白果仁嚼细涂之。[192p]

    When there is a foul discharge from the bowels, apply fragrant oil to the intestines, insert with the hand, and pour a decoction of ginseng and dikoupi over it. The skin will close on its own; consume lamb soup, and recovery will occur in ten days.

    In early spring and summer, when rabid dogs are common, observe if their tail hangs straight and does not curl, and if they have drool and a black tongue, these are signs of rabies. If bitten, it poses a risk of severe illness. Quickly pierce the wound to draw blood, clean it with human urine, fill a half walnut shell with human feces, place it over the wound, and apply moxa on it. When the shell is charred and the feces are dry, replace it and apply moxa until you have done this a hundred times; the next day, do another hundred. A total of three to five hundred applications is ideal.

    Another method: first rinse the mouth with clean water, or use hot human urine to cleanse the bite area, chew raw ginger and rub it, then use crushed green onion to apply, and crushed almonds to cover, securing it with cloth. Alternatively, finely grind the root of the horse vine, wash with scallion soup, and apply, which is especially effective.

    Yet another method: if there is a red hair on the afflicted person’s crown, it should be pulled out, and then they will respond quickly to medication.

    If a dog bites and the wound festers: chew almonds and apply. Another method: chew white ginkgo seeds finely and apply.[192p]

    In Fujian and Guangdong, there is a type of poisoning similar to that of the shooters, but with no specific things involved. Initially, the patient suffers from chills, fever, irritability, and strong pains in the joints; if not treated promptly, it can lead to worms that consume the organs and be fatal. Use a handful of purple knotweed with thick stalks, crush it with an equal volume of wine and water, strain the juice, and drink it warm, three times a day. [From "Elbow Post Method", same source] Another method: take the whole root and leaves of anemone, crush them to make a powder for consumption, or extract the juice and drink one to two liters. In summer, carry some shavings for use. Before entering the water, toss a small amount into the upstream to avoid fear. This also wards off shooters. It can also be boiled for use in baths, which is very beneficial.[208p]

    　　中射菵毒：大麻子汁饮之。
    　　又方：蚯蚓屎末，井水调服二方寸匕。 【《千金》】　　又方：猪血饮之，即解。 【《肘后方》，下同。】
    　　误吞蚂蝗：取田中泥，酒和一二升服之，当利出。

    　　射工溪毒：用鸡矢白者二枚，以钖和涂疮上。　　又方：鼠妇、豆豉、巴豆各三枚，脂和涂之。　　又方：用鸀鳿鸟近病人，即能唼人身讫，以物承之，当有沙出，其沙即含沙射人之箭也。又可笼鸟近人，令鸟气相吸，又取其屎烧灰，水服。

    Poison from arrows: drink juice from hemp seeds.
    Another remedy: powdered earthworm excrement, mixed with well water, take two inches of a tablespoon.
    Another remedy: drink pig’s blood; it will counteract the poison.
    If one accidentally swallows a leech: take mud from the field, mix with one or two liters of wine and drink, it will promote expulsion.
    For toxic water poisoning: boil three liters of garlic, bathe the body in it when it is slightly warm; if it gets too hot, one becomes weak. If the body develops red spots and stripes, do not treat as another illness.
    For poisoning from arrows in the creek: use two white chicken droppings, mix with mercury and apply to the wound. Another remedy: three each of pill-bug, fermented soybean, and croton seed, mixed with fat and applied.
    Another remedy: take a bird (the blue jay) near the afflicted person, it can peck the person; as materials absorb it, sand will come out that contains the arrow poison; one can also confine the bird near the person, allowing the bird's vapors to merge, then take its excrement, burn it to ash, and drink with water.
    For arrow poison ulcers: take one large centipede, roast and grind it, mix with vinegar and apply. Another remedy: wolf’s tooth, harvest the root in winter, the leaves in summer, pound for juice to drink four to five cups, and apply as well.[209p]

    　　沙虱在水中，人澡浴则着人身，钻入皮里，初得皮上正赤如小豆黍粟，摩之痛如刺，三日后寒热发疮，毒若入骨杀人。岭南多此。即以茅叶刮去，以苦菜汁涂之，佳。【《肘后方》，下同。】　　又方：莴苣菜捣汁涂之，良。
    　　又方：螌蝥二枚，一枚末服，一枚炼至烟尽，研细末，敷疮中，立瘥。
    　　蠼螋虫如小蜈蚣，色青黑，长足，隐于壁间，以尿射人，遍身生疮，出黄水，甚于汤火伤，繞身匝即死。乌鸡翎烧灰，鸡子清调涂之。【《纲目》】　　又方：取扁豆叶挼敷即瘥。 【《本草》】　　又方：梨叶捣涂之，干即易。 【《箧中方》】　　又方：槐白皮酢浸半日，洗之。 【《千金翼》】　　又方：画地作蠼螋形，以刀细取腹中土，唾和涂之，再涂即愈。孙真人子得此疾，经五六日不愈，或教此法遂瘳。乃知万物相感，莫晓其由也。【《千金》，下同。】　　又方：酢和胡粉涂之。[210p]

    The沙虱 (sand eel) lives in water; when a person bathes, it attaches itself to the body, burrowing into the skin. At first, it appears on the skin as red as small beans, and rubbing it causes pain like being pricked. After three days, cold and heat cause sores, and the poison penetrates the bones, potentially lethal. This is common in Lingnan. It can be removed by scraping with reed leaves and applying the juice of bitter vegetables, which is beneficial.

    Another remedy: pound the juice of lettuce and apply it, which is effective.

    Yet another method: take two roaches, consume one powdered, and refine the other until the smoke is gone. Grind it into a fine powder and place it on the sores, which will immediately heal.

    The蠼螋虫 (mole cricket) resembles a small centipede, dark blue-black in color, with long legs, hiding within walls. It shoots urine at people, causing sores that produce yellow fluid, worse than burns from fire, and if it wraps around the body, it leads to death. Burn black chicken feathers to ash, mix it with the clear liquid from chicken eggs, and apply it.

    Another remedy: take flat bean leaves, crush and apply them to heal instantly.

    Another method: mash pear leaves and apply; when dry, replace them.

    Another remedy: soak white locust bark in vinegar for half a day and wash it off.

    Another method: draw a mole cricket shape in the ground, use a knife to carefully extract the dirt from its belly, mix with saliva and apply, repeating the application results in healing. A man, Son of the Realist, suffered from this illness for five or six days without improvement until he was taught this method and subsequently recovered, realizing that all things are interconnected and the reasons are often unknown.

    Another remedy: mix vinegar with胡粉 (a type of flour) and apply it.[210p]

    　　又方：乌鸡翅毛烧灰，油调敷之，虫畏鸡故也。 【《顼碎录》】　　又方：大麦嚼敷之，日三上。 【《类要》】　　又方：磨犀角汁涂之。 【《千金》】　　又方：鹿角烧末，苦酒调服。 【《外台》】　　又方：治疮初如掺粟，渐大如豆，更大如火烙浆泡，疼痛至甚者，速以草茶并蜡茶俱可，以生油调敷，药至痛乃止。【《胜金方》】　　又方：盐汤浸绵，拓疮上。 【《食疗》】　　又方：以蒺藜捣敷之，无叶用子。 【《备急方》】　　又方：杵豉敷之，良。虫刺螫人，豉心嚼敷，少顷见豉中有毛，即瘥。不见再敷，昼夜勿绝，见毛为度。【《外台》】[211p]

    　　蠼螋咬疮：大黄末涂之。 【《医说》】

    For wounds caused by cricket bites: Apply a powder of rhubarb.

    　　人被天蛇毒，似癞而非癞。天蛇即草间黄花蜘蛛也，人被其螫，因为露水所濡，乃成此疾，遂煎秦皮汁一升饮之，瘥。

    When a person is poisoned by the celestial snake, it resembles leprosy but is not leprosy. The celestial snake refers to the yellow flower spider of the grass. When a person is stung by it, the dew causes the illness, and thus, boiling a liter of Qinpi juice and drinking it heals the ailment.

    For a sting from a spider: lightly tap a small hole in a raw chicken egg, and seal the bite area; it will heal immediately.

    For injuries from various poisonous insects: dip a large paper twist in fragrant oil, burn it, and let the smoke heal the wounds.

    The poisoning from a flower spider is no different from that of a venomous snake. Crush a cup of cang'er (Xanthium) juice and consume it, applying the residue to the bite.

    In the mountains, there are stone leeches that, when attached to a person’s foot, penetrate the skin and injure. Simply apply pig fat mixed with salt to the legs and toes, and they will not attach to a person.

    In the south, where it rains often, there is something called the water nephew, resembling mucus, that grows on ancient trees. When it senses human breath, it twitches; if a person passes beneath it and it falls onto them, it will create sores, spreading over time. Only by applying cinnabar and musk will it heal.

    Snail Bite: For those affected by poison throughout the body, soak in water boiled with smartweed, and recovery will be swift. It is not advisable to approach the shade as it weakens one.

    Cure for Yellow Fly Poison: In the Wumeng Mountain Gorge, there are many small yellow flies that generate venom in their scales. When bitten, one feels no initial pain but experiences gradual itching leading to sores. Do not scratch; instead, water it with cold water and apply a little salt, which will prevent it from becoming a sore.

    Insect Bite Treatment: Apply oil made from purple root. Another method is to mix ghee with blood and apply it.

    Caterpillar Poison Treatment: Take the white juice from dandelion roots and stems to apply directly, and healing will be immediate. Another method: use finely ground yellow earth from the bottom of a pot, knead it with vinegar into a ball, and rub it on the itchy painful area. The hairs will come off, and pain and itching will cease immediately, proving remarkably effective.

    During summer, there are variably colored caterpillars that are extremely toxic, causing sores and intense pain; the flesh may rot. Use one bowl of fermented soybeans and half a cup of clear oil, mash together and apply thickly to the affected area overnight. The next day, check for caterpillars in the soybean mixture and bury them in the ground. Wash the area with a white ginger decoction, then apply ground fish bones, and healing will occur.

    Fumigation to Remove Lice: Lay down nightshade leaves on a mat, and by the next day, fleas and lice will be completely dead. Nightshade, also known as the black nightshade or old crow’s eye grass.

    Fumigation to Remove Lice: Grind hundred-leaf herb and gentian into a powder, place it in a bamboo container, and burn to create smoke which will cause the lice to fall off; it can also be used to wash clothing in soup.[214p]

    　　　　针灸

    　　《千金方》曰：凡春夏初交，犬多发狂，但见其尾直下不卷，口中流涎舌黑者，即是狂犬。若被其伤，乃九死一生之患。急用针刺去血，以人小便洗净，用桃核壳半边，以人粪填满，掩其疮上，着艾灸之，壳焦粪干则易之，灸至百壮，次日又灸百壮，灸至三五百壮为住。　　被狂犬咬者，只就咬牙迹上灸之，一日三壮，灸至一百二十日乃止，常食韭菜，永不再发。　　凡猘犬所嚙，未尽其恶血毒者，灸上一百壮，已后，当日灸一壮。若不血出，刺出其血，百日灸乃止。禁饮酒及猪犬肉。　　凡众蛇螫，灸上三七壮。[215p]

    In May, gather floating pondweed, dry it in the shade, and burn it to drive away mosquitoes.

    For bedbugs, use wheat straw to make cakes and burn them to produce smoke.

    To eliminate bedbugs, slice papaya and lay it under the mat.

    For itching caused by pubic lice, if bugs like lice appear in the flesh near the pubic hair, either red or white and causing unbearable itching, chew the white fruit kernel finely and rub it frequently; it will take effect.

    Dried neem flowers laid under the mat can kill fleas and lice.

    Acupuncture

    The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" states: Generally, when spring and summer first intersect, dogs frequently become rabid. If you see a dog with its tail held straight down and not curled, and it has drool and a black tongue, that is a rabid dog. If bitten, it is a serious condition with a survival rate of only one in nine. Urgently use a needle to draw blood, wash it clean with human urine, fill half of the peach pit shell with human excrement, cover the wound with it, and apply moxibustion. When the shell is charred and the excrement is dry, it can be removed. Apply moxibustion until achieving a hundred strong burns; the next day do another hundred, continuing to three to five hundred robust burns until the issue is resolved.

    For those bitten by a rabid dog, perform moxibustion directly on the bite mark, three times a day, until completing one hundred and twenty burns before stopping. Regular consumption of leeks prevents recurrence.

    For bites from wild dogs, before the bad blood is fully expelled, perform moxibustion one hundred times, and then one burn each day thereafter. If blood does not come out, prick to draw the blood; stop moxibustion after one hundred days. Abstain from alcohol and meat from pigs and dogs.

    For bites from numerous snakes, apply moxibustion three to seven times.[215p]

    无艾，以火头称疮孔大小爇之。　　《丹溪心法》曰：凡蛇虺蜈蚣毒蛇咬伤，于伤处灸五壮或七壮，即愈。　　《资生方》曰：狂犬咬人，当先针刺去恶血，仍灸疮中十壮；自后日灸一壮，至百日乃止。忌饮酒。常饮韭菜自然汁，以滓封灸疮，永不再发。　　《医学纲目》曰：猘犬伤，毒不出，发寒热，速以艾灸外丘穴二壮；又灸所咬之处七壮，立愈。　　治风狗咬，用桃核壳半个，将野地干人粪填满，以榆皮盖定，罨于伤处，又用艾于桃核上灸十四壮，即愈，永不再发。或用野犬粪，如前法灸之。　　又方：艾灸伤处五七壮。[216p]

    Without moxa, use a fire stick to burn the size of the wound. The "Danxi Heart Method" states: For snake, centipede, and poisonous snake bites, perform five or seven moxibustions on the affected area, and it will heal. The "Zisheng Fang" mentions: If bitten by a rabid dog, first bleed out the evil blood with a needle, then perform ten moxibustions on the wound; afterwards, moxibustion once daily until a hundred days have passed. Avoid drinking alcohol. Regularly drink natural juice of leek to seal and moxibustion the wound, preventing recurrence. The "Medical Principles" says: For dog bites, if the poison remains and causes cold and fever, promptly perform two moxibustions on the outer hill acupoint; also moxibustion seven times on the bitten area for immediate recovery. To treat bites from fierce dogs, use half a peach kernel shell filled with dry human feces from the wild, cover it with elm bark, and apply it to the wound; also burn moxa on the peach kernel fourteen times for recovery, preventing recurrence. Alternatively, wild dog feces can be used and treated as above. Another method: Moxibustion on the wound five to seven times.[216p]

    　　《本草纲目》曰：诸虫蛇伤人，艾灸患处数壮，甚良。　　射工溪毒，独头蒜切三分，厚贴之，上用艾灸，令蒜气射入即瘥。　　被毒蛇螫，即贴蛇皮于螫处，艾火灸其上，引出毒气。
    　　　　医案

    　　《夷坚志》曰：毒蛇伤螫，临川有人被蝮蛇咬伤，即昏死，一臂如股，少顷，遍身皮胀黄黑色，一道人以新汲水调香白芷末一斤灌之，觉脐中汩汨然，黄水自口出，腥秽逆人，良久消缩如故。又云以麦门冬汤调尤妙，仍以末搽之。[217p]

    The "Compendium of Materia Medica" states: When one is bitten by various insects or snakes, applying moxa to the affected area several times is very effective. For a snakebite, take a whole garlic clove, cut it into three pieces, press it against the bite site, and apply moxa on top, allowing the garlic's essence to penetrate and promote healing. If bitten by a poisonous snake, one should place snake skin on the bite area and use moxa to draw out the venom.

    In a medical case record from "Yijian Zhi", it is said that a person in Linchuan was bitten by a viper and immediately fell unconscious, with one arm swelling to the size of a thigh. After a while, the entire body showed yellow-black swelling. A person took freshly drawn water, mixed it with one pound of fragrant white angelica powder, and administered it; the patient felt a bubbling sensation in the stomach, followed by yellow fluid coming out of the mouth, with a foul odor that was hard to endure. After a long while, the body shrank back to its original state. It is also mentioned that using a mixture of wheat kernel soup is particularly effective, alongside applying the powder on the skin.[217p]

    　　径山寺僧为蛇伤，一脚溃烂，百药不愈。一游僧以新水数洗净腐败，见白筋挹干，以白芷末人胆矾、麝香少许掺之，恶水涌出，日日如此，一月平复。
    　　《薛己医案》日：陈镒，居庸关人，蝎螫手，疼痛彻心，顷刻焮痛至胁，寒热拘急，头痛恶心，此邪正二气相搏而然，以飞龙夺命丹涂患处及服止痛之药，俱不应，乃以隔蒜灸法灸之遂愈。余母及余，皆尝被螫，如前灸之，痛即止。余母又尝为娱蚣伤指，亦用前法而愈。凡蛇毒之类所伤，依此疗之，并效。《本草》谓蒜疗疮毒有回生之功，信哉！
    　　一猎户腿被狼咬痛甚，治以乳香定痛散不应。余思至阴之下，气血凝结，药力难达，令隔蒜灸至五十余壮，疼痛悉去；仍以托里药及膏药贴之而愈。
    　　王生被鬬犬伤腿，顷问焮痛至股，翊日牙关紧急，以玉真散治之不应，亦隔蒜灸三十余壮而苏，仍以玉真散及托里消毒药而愈。[218p]

    At Jing Mountain Temple, a monk was bitten by a snake, resulting in a severely rotten foot that did not heal despite various treatments. A visiting monk cleaned the wound with fresh water several times, and upon discovering white tendons exposed, he mixed a small amount of white angelica powder, human gall, and musk into it. As a result, foul water began to drain out, and this process was repeated daily, eventually leading to recovery after a month.

    In the case notes of Xue Ji, it states: Chen Yi, a resident of Juyong Pass, was stung on the hand by a scorpion, causing excruciating pain that radiated to his side, chills and heat, and severe headache and nausea. This was a result of the conflict between the pathogenic and the normal energies. Despite applying the Flying Dragon Life Snatching Pills to the affected area and taking pain relief medications, he saw no effect. Eventually, by using the garlic moxibustion method, he was cured. My mother and I have also been stung before, and using the same method, the pain ceased immediately. My mother also once had her finger injured by a centipede, and using the same method, she recovered. For injuries caused by snake venom, treating them this way has proven effective. The "Compendium of Materia Medica" mentions that garlic can treat wound toxins and has the ability to restore life, which is indeed true!

    A hunter suffered a severe bite on his leg from a wolf, and treatment with frankincense pain relief powder was ineffective. I reasoned that in such a Yin condition, qi and blood had congealed, making it difficult for medicine to penetrate. I instructed him to undergo garlic moxibustion over fifty times, after which the pain completely subsided. I then applied tonifying medications and plasters for further healing.

    Wang Sheng was bitten on the leg by a dog, and shortly thereafter experienced sharp pain radiating to his thigh. The next day his jaw was tight and urgent, and treatment with the Jade True Powder showed no effect. Again, after undergoing garlic moxibustion for over thirty times, he recovered, and then he used Jade True Powder and tonifying disinfectant medications, leading to complete healing.[218p]

    　　《医学纲目》曰：张荐昔在剑南为张廷赏判官，忽被斑蜘蛛咬项上，一宿咬处有两道赤色，粗细如箸，绕顶上，从胸前至心经；二宿头面肿疼，如数升碗大，肚渐肿，几至不救。张相素重荐，因出家财五百千，并荐家财五百千，募能疗者。忽一人应召，云可治。张相初不甚信，欲验其方，遂令目前合药。其人云不惜方，当疗人性命耳。遂取大蓝汁一磁碗，取蜘蛛投入蓝汁，良久方出，甚困不能动；又别捣蓝汁，复加麝香、雄黄和之，更取一蜘蛛投汁中，随化为水。张相及诸人甚异之，遂令点于咬处，两日内悉愈。但咬处作小疮，痂落如旧。
    　　有人被毒蛇所伤已昏困，有老僧以酒调药二钱灌之，遂苏。及以药滓涂患处，良久复灌二钱，其苦皆去。问之，乃五灵脂一两，雄黄半两，同为末，止此耳。后有中毒者用之，无不效验。
    [219p]

    The "Medical Essentials" states: Zhang Jian was once a judge in the Jian Nan region under Zhang Ting Shang. Suddenly, he was bitten on the neck by a spotted spider. By the next morning, the bite area had developed two red lines, thick and thin like chopsticks, wrapping around from the top of his head down to his chest, reaching the heart. By the second day, his face and head were swollen and painful, nearly reaching a size comparable to a bowl. His abdomen also began to swell, bringing him to the brink of death. Zhang valued the recommendation highly, so he allocated five hundred thousand from his family’s wealth and likewise requested five hundred thousand from his family to find a healer. Suddenly, a person responded, claiming to be able to treat him. At first, Zhang did not believe him much and wanted to test his methods, so he ordered the preparation of the medicine in front of him. The man said he wouldn't spare any formula as he was treating a person’s life. He then took a large bowl of indigo juice and added the spider into it, leaving it for a long time until it emerged, very weak and unable to move. He then ground the indigo juice again and mixed it with musk and realgar, adding another spider into the mixture, which immediately turned into liquid. Zhang and the others were very surprised, and they applied it to the bite area. Within two days, he was completely healed, but the bite site had turned into small sores, with scabs falling off as usual.

    There was also a case where a person was poisoned by a snake and had lost consciousness. An old monk gave him a two-qian dose mixed with wine to drink, and he regained consciousness. He then used the residue from the medicine to apply to the affected area, and after a while, he again administered a two-qian dose, which alleviated all the bitterness. Upon questioning, it was revealed that the ingredients were one ounce of five-spirit resin and half an ounce of realgar, ground into powder; that was all there was. Later, those who were poisoned used it, and it proved effective on all occasions.[219p]
